commit_message:
Propose follow-on comments for unified limits

This change mostly consists of formatting changes that the author
can incorporate into the main document if they choose to. Many of the
changes are to the propose API section so that it will be easier to
copy/paste it into our formal documentation when the implementation
merges.

Change-Id: I27d4a4f291aea261af4994c1e35af64ba5bbc422
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone-specs refs/changes/76/522876/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ================== Unified Limits API ================== Detailed specification for the work necessary to associate resources limits to projects. `bp unified-limits <https://blueprints.launchpad.net/keystone/+spec/unified-limits>`_The following API calls are specific to the management of Registered Limits. Create a Registered Limit ------------------------- Limits are registered with the Registered Limits endpoint. Becauseaction. A limit is considered unique based on the combination of ``service_type``, ``region``, and ``resource_name``. **Request:** ``POST /registered-limits`` **Parameters** * ``service_type`` - The service that is responsible for the resource, which should match a service in the service catalog. * ``region`` - The region that the service is hosted in. * ``resource_name`` - The name of the resource, which should be unique compared to other resource names for the same service and region. * ``default_limit`` - The default limit for all projects to assume for that resource. **Request Body** "limits": [A full list of all registered limits... code-block:: json { "limits": [ { "service_type": "compute", "region": "region1", "resource_name": "cores", "default_limit": 10 }, { "service_type": "compute", "region": "region1", "resource_name": "ram_mb", "default_limit": 20480 }, { "service_type": "volume", "region": "region1", "resource_name": "storage_gb", "default_limit": 20 }, ] } List all Registered Limits --------------------------**Request:** ``GET /registered-limits``A full list of all registered limits. * 200 - OK * 401 - Unauthorized "limits": [ { "service_type": "volume", "region": "region1", "resource_name": "storage_gb", "default_limit": 20 },Update a Registered Limit -------------------------to override are included. If the ``service_type``, ``region``, or ``resource_name`` doesn't already exist, an error is thrown. **Request:** ``PUT /registered-limits`` **Parameters** * ``service_type`` - The service that is responsible for the resource, which should match a service in the service catalog. * ``region`` - The region that the service is hosted in. * ``resource_name`` - The name of the resource, which should be unique compared to other resource names for the same service and region. * ``default_limit`` - The default limit for all projects to assume for that resource. **Request Body*** 400 - Bad Request .. code-block:: json { "limits": [ { "service_type": "compute", "region": "region1", "resource_name": "cores", "default_limit": 10 }, { "service_type": "compute", "region": "region1", "resource_name": "ram_mb", "default_limit": 10240 }, { "service_type": "volume", "region": "region1", "resource_name": "storage_gb", "default_limit": 20 }, ] } Delete a Registered Limit -------------------------**Request:** ``DELETE /registered-limits`` **Parameters** * ``service_type`` - The service that is responsible for the resource, which should match a service in the service catalog. * ``region`` - The region that the service is hosted in. * ``resource_name`` - The name of the resource, which should be unique compared to other resource names for the same service and region. **Request Body*** 204 - No Content * 404 - Not FoundAll the Registered Limits resource above have no UUID. Although there is no problem in code logic, it's inconsistent with other keystone resources. So if we'd like to keep it the same as other resources, the Registered Limits shouldThe following API calls are specific to the management of Project Limits. Create or update a Project Limit --------------------------------**Request:** ``PUT /limits/{project_id}`` When users set or update a project's limit, keystone will check the related hierarchical limit, including default Registered Limits and Project Limits within the project hierarchy. This spec doesn't talk about the usage check, only making sure the limits in the hierarchy don't violate each other. If we want to support usage check for limit, keystone would need to collect usage information from each of the services. This will add more REST requests in keystone, which we should be careful about doing. List Project Limits -------------------**Request:** ``GET /limits/{project_id}``Delete a Project Limit ---------------------- The same as the DELETE call for a Registered Limit. If no UUID, it will be like PUT, otherwise it should be DELETE /limits/{project_id}/{limit_id}. **Request:** ``DELETE /limits/{project_id}`` **Parameters** * ``service_type`` - The service that is responsible for the resource, which should match a service in the service catalog. * ``region`` - The region that the service is hosted in. * ``resource_name`` - The name of the resource, which should be unique compared to other resource names for the same service and region. **Request Body** .. code-block:: json { "limits":[ { "service_type": "compute", "region": "region1", "resource_name": "ram_mb", } ] } **Response:** * 204 - No Content * 404 - Not Foundadmin filter. If non-admin users use this filter, keystone should ignore the**Request:** ``GET /limits/{project_id}?show_hierachy=true`` **Parameters** * ``project_id`` - The ID of the project to fetch limit information for.Leave Colleen's comment here so that we can have more discussion: .. warning:: Colleen: Registered limits are public information, but what about project limits? Should a user be able to get limit information for a parent, sibling, or child project? This might be necessary information in order to answer the "what do I put in the ticket" question, but it's also really private information. With the (current) default policy a user with a member role on a project can't GET its parent or child project. .. warning:: Wxy: Try to answer Collen's concern. Here is my thought: A. The user in a child project should not get the parent project's limit due to the security and permission. A. When error occurs after the admin user in one project try to create or update it's limits, the administrator in this project should know what is happened. We mainly focus on 400 and 403 error. 400 - Bad Request. This error usually means that the input format is not correct. Then Keystone will tell users what the right format looks like. This error also could be that the limit is greater than parent project's limit. Then Keystone should tell users something like "the new limits value will break current hierarchical limits" but don't show the detail limits value. 403 - Forbidden. This is not suggested, because 403 usually means that the request body is OK but some other things block it. Such as policy check, resource status check and so on. In the case we are talking, users could change the request body and send again which I think is not suitable for 403 error.notifications as other resources in keystone.End users will be able to query keystone for limit information. This improves usability because they can see what the limit is and gather more information when requesting help from an administrator. It is also worth noting that both Registered Limits and Project Limits are not expected to change frequently. This means the data is safe to cache for some period of time. Caching will be implemented internally to keystone, similar to how keystone caches responses for other resources. But, caching can also be done client-side to avoid making frequent calls to keystone for relatively static limit information.Deployments looking to have Registered Limits and Project Limits in keystoneDevelopers from other projects will likely have the following questions: * What the difference between a Registered Limits and Project Limit? * What information is relayed in the limit? * How do I enforce usage based on the information about a limit? * Is there a library to do this for me? There are a lot of things we'll have to make sure we communicate to developers looking to implement hierarchical quotas. Keystone's really just the information point here. We need to be available on the other side to help them consume that information. These questions, among others, will likely have to be answered in developer documentation within keystone.Primary assignee: * wangxiyuan<wangxiyuan@huawei.com> Other contributors: * Lance Bragstad<lbragstad@gmail.com> * Colleen Murphy<colleen@gazlene.net>The `epic <https://trello.com/c/OMtxcBeh/16-unified-limits>`_ tracking this work can be found in keystone's Queens roadmap. High-level `overview <http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/ongoing/unified-limits.html>`_ of limits.
deleted_lines: =================== Keystone Limits API =================== Create ~~~~~~ Limits are registered with the registered limits endpoint. Becauseaction. **Request:** :: POST /registered-limits "limits":[A full list of all limits.Read ~~~~ **Request:** :: GET /registered-limits "limits":[* 200 - OK Update ~~~~~~ to override are included. If any of these do not exist already, that's an error. **Request:** :: PUT /registered-limits Delete ~~~~~~ **Request:** :: DELETE /registered-limits* 204 - No contentAll the registered-limits resource above have no UUID. Although there is no problem in code logic, it's inconsistent with other Keystone resources. So if we'd like to keep the same with other resources, the registered-limits shouldCreate/Update ~~~~~~~~~~~~~ **Request:** :: PUT /limits/{project_id} When users set or update a project's limit, Keystone will check the related hierarchical limit. This spec doesn't talk about the usage check. Because if we want to support usage check for limit, we should let keystone get the resource usage from other services first. Then we'll add more REST requests in Keystone which I think we should be careful. Read ~~~~ **Request:** :: GET /limits/{project_id}Delete ~~~~~~ The same as registered-limits. If no UUID, it will be like PUT, otherwise it should be DELETE /limits/{project_id}/{limit_id}.admin filter. If non-admin users use this filter, Keystone should ignore the**Request:** :: GET /limits/{project_id}?show_hierachy=trueLeave Collen's comment here so that we can have more discussion: Collen: Registered limits are public information, but what about project limits? Should a user be able to get limit information for a parent, sibling, or child project? This might be necessary information in order to answer the "what do I put in the ticket" question, but it's also really private information. With the (current) default policy a user with a member role on a project can't GET its parent or child project. Wxy: Try to answer Collen's concern. Here is my thought: 1. The user in a child project should not get the parent project's limit due to the security and permission. 2. When error occurs after the admin user in one project try to create or update it's limits, the administrator in this project should know what is happened. We mainly focus on 400 and 403 error. - 400, Bad Request. This error usually means that the input format is not correct. Then Keystone will tell users what the right format looks like. This error also could be that the limit is greater than parent project's limit. Then Keystone should tell users something like "the new limits value will break current hierarchical limits" but don't show the detail limits value. - 403, Forbidden. This is not suggested, because 403 usually means that the request body is OK but some other things block it. Such as policy check, resource status check and so on. In the case we are talking, users could change the request body and send again which I think is not sutiable for 403 error.notifications as other things in keystone.Deployments looking to have registered limits and project limits in keystoneDevelopers from other projects are going to have to be educated on: - what the difference between a registered limits and project limit is - what information is relayed in the limit - how to enforce things depending on the model - if there is a library to do this for them There are a lot of things we'll have to make sure we communicate to developers looking to implement hierarchical quotas. Keystone's really just the information point here. We need to be available on the other side to help them consume that information. Lance Bragstad<lbragstad@gmail.com> Colleen Murphy<colleen@gazlene.net> wangxiyuan<wangxiyuan@huawei.com>[1]: http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/ongoing/unified-limits.html

commit_message:
Remove yum-axelget with overrides in tripleo_kolla_template_overrides

Image build jobs for Master are failing after a commit merged
to include EPEL-based package yum-axelget. This review patches
the overrides to remove yum-axelget.

Change-Id: Id26b59b028a889f825ec3c648f656bfb8170eb59
Closes-Bug: 1734752

commit_message:
Bump PyKMIP to 0.7.0

This change bumps the PyKMIP min version to 0.7.0, which is
required for upcoming Barbican patches.

See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/519757/ for proof that 0.7.0
works with Barbican.

Change-Id: I2aad6eb1e3ad13755f985de634f25b7c431674fa

commit_message:
Use cinder_services dict to identify cinder-api service name

Instead of assuming the name, we use the dict as a reference.
This means it will work, even if someone overrides the dict
for some reason.

Change-Id: I7adae469e725fd0de84d1c75161ceffbe0a63c3e

added_lines: import base64def validate_totp(value): try: base64.b32decode(value) except TypeError: raise exception.ValidationError( message=_('Invalid base32 blob in credential')) # NOTE(dstanek): maybe put this in stevedore? credential_validators = {'totp': validate_totp} if credential['type'] in credential_validators: validator = credential_validators[credential['type']] validator(credential['blob']) if ('type' in credential and credential['type'] in credential_validators): validator = credential_validators[credential['type']] if 'blob' in credential: validator(credential['blob']) else: ref = self.credential_api.get_credential(credential_id) ref = self._blob_to_json(ref) validator(ref['blob']) # TODO(dstanek): better error message? elif 'blob' in credential: ref = self.credential_api.get_credential(credential_id) if ref['type'] in credential_validators: validator = credential_validators[ref['type']] validator(credential['blob'])

commit_message:
Replace the native quickstart inventory with ansible-role-tripleo-inventory

- Inventory is a core feature of a virt provisioning tool. At the
moment, quickstart is pulling in art-inventory [1] via requirements.txt.
This patch is dumping art-inventory [1] directly into quickstart itself.
- Convert roles/tripleo-inventory/README.md in rst format.
- Remove some extra newlines at end of file.
- Remove unnecessary files and directory.

[1] - https://github.com/redhat-openstack/ansible-role-tripleo-inventory

Change-Id: I1f20a69ca13de99eda0d98a26c63c66524b22dc8
Closes-Bug: 1604517
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Route based RBAC Management Bulk API

Munges the roles, implied roles, and routes
data into a single, fetchable API

No RBAC enforcement is done in this commit.

blueprint token-verify-role-check
SecurityImpact
APIImpact

Change-Id: I63234ea8cbff639bdc9b4e9772c474b40a8a89d5
Co-Authored-By: Kristi Nikolla <knikolla@bu.edu>

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/83/458983/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. -*- rst -*- ====== Routes ====== OpenStack services typically determine whether a user's API request should be allowed using Role Based Access Control (RBAC). For OpenStack this means the service compares the roles that user has on the project (as indicated by the roles in the token), against the roles required for the API in question (as defined in the service's policy file). A user obtains roles on a project by having these assigned to them via the Identity service API. List Routes =========== .. rest_method:: GET /v3/routes Relationship: ``https://docs.openstack.org/api/openstack-identity/3/rel/routes`` Lists routes. Response Codes -------------- .. rest_status_code:: success status.yaml - 200 .. rest_status_code:: error status.yaml - 400 - 401 - 403 Request Parameters ------------------ .. rest_parameters:: parameters.yaml - service: service_type_query - verb: verb_query - path: path_query - role_id: role_id_query Response Parameters ------------------- .. rest_parameters:: parameters.yaml - links: link_collection - routes: routes - domain_id: domain_id_response_body - id: role_id_response_body - links: link_response_body - name: role_name_response_body Response Example ---------------- .. literalinclude:: ./samples/admin/roles-list-response.json :language: javascript Create role =========== .. rest_method:: POST /v3/routes Relationship: ``https://docs.openstack.org/api/openstack-identity/3/rel/routes`` Creates a route. Response Codes -------------- .. rest_status_code:: success status.yaml - 201 .. rest_status_code:: error status.yaml - 400 - 401 - 403 - 409 Request Parameters ------------------ .. rest_parameters:: parameters.yaml - role: role - name: role_name_create_body - domain_id: domain_id_response_body Request Example --------------- .. literalinclude:: ./samples/admin/role-create-request.json :language: javascript Request Example for Domain Specific Role ---------------------------------------- .. literalinclude:: ./samples/admin/domain-specific-role-create-request.json :language: javascript Response Parameters ------------------- .. rest_parameters:: parameters.yaml - role: role - domain_id: domain_id_response_body - id: role_id_response_body - links: link_response_body - name: role_name_response_body Show role details ================= .. rest_method:: GET /v3/roles/{role_id} Relationship: ``https://docs.openstack.org/api/openstack-identity/3/rel/role`` Shows details for a role. Response Codes -------------- .. rest_status_code:: success status.yaml - 200 .. rest_status_code:: error status.yaml - 400 - 401 - 403 - 404 Request Parameters ------------------ .. rest_parameters:: parameters.yaml - role_id: role_id_path Response Parameters ------------------- .. rest_parameters:: parameters.yaml - role: role - domain_id: domain_id_response_body - id: role_id_response_body - links: link_response_body - name: role_name_response_body Response Example ---------------- .. literalinclude:: ./samples/admin/role-show-response.json :language: javascript Update role =========== .. rest_method:: PATCH /v3/roles/{role_id} Relationship: ``https://docs.openstack.org/api/openstack-identity/3/rel/role`` Updates a role. Response Codes -------------- .. rest_status_code:: success status.yaml - 200 .. rest_status_code:: error status.yaml - 400 - 401 - 403 - 404 - 409 Request Parameters ------------------ .. rest_parameters:: parameters.yaml - role_id: role_id_path - role: role - name: role_name_update_body Request Example --------------- .. literalinclude:: ./samples/admin/role-update-request.json :language: javascript Response Parameters ------------------- .. rest_parameters:: parameters.yaml - role: role - domain_id: domain_id_response_body - id: role_id_response_body - links: link_response_body - name: role_name_response_body Response Example ---------------- .. literalinclude:: ./samples/admin/role-update-response.json :language: javascript Delete role =========== .. rest_method:: DELETE /v3/routes/{role_id} Relationship: ``https://docs.openstack.org/api/openstack-identity/3/rel/role`` Deletes a role. Response Codes -------------- .. rest_status_code:: success status.yaml - 204 .. rest_status_code:: error status.yaml - 400 - 401 - 403 - 404 Request Parameters ------------------ .. rest_parameters:: parameters.yaml - role_id: role_id_path

commit_message:
Fix create redis instance with new requirepass

When create redis instance with a configuration which has requirepass
value(not 'foobared'). Period task still use old password to poll instance's
status, so instance create failed because authentication error. Applied
requirepass at runtime and refresh admin client after apply_user_override
to fix it.

Change-Id: I27598a9031efcb74821f77c36710d224b3a9a0e6
Closes-bug: #1733815

commit_message:
RHEL/Update: replace wc by yum to check updates

Similar to I8bd89f2b24bafc6c991382b9eb484cfa9a2f8968,
use yum to check if updates are available during RHEL registration and
run upgrades only when there are some.

Change-Id: I42cd699d21cbec7d754edf1b8d83e75de0f2c7d9
(cherry picked from commit b336b45102a0201bb0e8f5c583697fa1083e232e)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/96/522396/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # yum check-update exits 100 if updates are available set +e check_update=$(yum check-update 2>&1) check_update_exit=$? set -e if [[ "$check_update_exit" == "100" ]]; then full_command="yum -q -y update" echo "Running: $full_command" result=$($full_command) return_code=$? echo "$result" echo "yum return code: $return_code" exit $return_code elif [[ "$check_update_exit" == "1" ]]; then echo "Failed to check for package updates" echo "$check_update" else
deleted_lines: num_updates=$(yum list -q updates | wc -l) if [ "$num_updates" -eq "0" ]; then full_command="yum -q -y update" echo "Running: $full_command" result=$($full_command) return_code=$? echo "$result" echo "yum return code: $return_code" exit $return_code

commit_message:
Allow for update after RHEL registration

Adds the ability to perform a yum update after performing the RHEL
registration.

Depends-On: I70afa68fbc1d941b128fadcc1d25b4d3e4a88d8b
Change-Id: Id84d156cd28413309981d5943242292a3a6fa807
Partial-Bug: #1640894
(cherry picked from commit c4fd8286761a976ff22e331b7edfb742c7fc425a)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/33/522033/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: UpdateOnRHELRegistration: type: boolean default: false description: | When enabled, the system will perform a yum update after performing the RHEL Registration process. YumUpdateConfigurationAfterRHELRegistration: type: OS::Heat::SoftwareConfig properties: group: script config: | #!/bin/bash set -x num_updates=$(yum list -q updates | wc -l) if [ "$num_updates" -eq "0" ]; then echo "No packages require updating" exit 0 fi full_command="yum -q -y update" echo "Running: $full_command" result=$($full_command) return_code=$? echo "$result" echo "yum return code: $return_code" exit $return_code UpdateDeploymentAfterRHELRegistration: type: OS::Heat::SoftwareDeployment depends_on: RHELRegistrationDeployment conditions: update_requested: {get_param: UpdateOnRHELRegistration} properties: name: UpdateDeploymentAfterRHELRegistration config: {get_resource: YumUpdateConfigurationAfterRHELRegistration} server: {get_param: server} actions: ['CREATE'] # Only do this on CREATE

commit_message:
Create pre-generated fake subunit file

Return subnit file for tracking all failed jobs in openstack health
system, even if they didn't reach step of running tempest tests.

Change-Id: If6709390aa5f10d94e7be86e5cc3a5ab4236f472

commit_message:
Add role to setup any centos vm to look like nodepool vm

This role will clone the needed CI repos and make sure the
/etc/nodepool files are in place in order to run the toci
scripts on a cloud provisioned CentOS guest.

Change-Id: I7b0b3f27ee012583c22eb1a4372e61cda7a429f1

commit_message:
tasks: Remove unused apache configuration

The barbican role is using uwsgi instead of Apache so remove
the playbooks related to Apache and SSL configuration.

Change-Id: I58a2f3ecbcd6de0cc0d345e9f6f1bb1027c22c92

commit_message:
ironic.conf.sample includes default_resource_class

This updates ironic.conf.sample to include the new configuration
option default_resource_class. This is a followup to
265993316b53abac234600b4b516965b82270e16.

Related-Bug: #1732190

zip() against a list of allocation request resource lists.

commit_message:
finish refactor AllocCandidates._get_by_filters()

This patch completes the refactoring of the
AllocationCandidates._get_by_filters() mega-method by splitting out the
remaining pieces of code that handle the construction of the
part-shared, part-non-shared allocation requests for when there are
sharing providers in a deployment.

The split-out _alloc_candidates_with_shared() is still a long, complex
method and I'll continue trying to reduce the complexity there and break
functions out of it further. I did uncomplicate a part of the function
with use of the itertools.product() function to replace a faulty use of
zip() against a list of allocation request resource lists.

Closes-Bug: #1730730
Change-Id: Ibcfd1a28f36d3c7ccd26fcc6386207e4a25300d4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/82/516782/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _alloc_candidates_no_shared(ctx, requested_resources, rp_ids): """Returns a tuple of (allocation requests, provider summaries) for a supplied set of requested resource amounts and resource providers. The supplied resource providers have capacity to satisfy ALL of the resources in the requested resources. This is an optimized code path for the common scenario when no sharing providers exist in the system for any requested resource. In this scenario, we can more efficiently build the list of AllocationRequest and ProviderSummary objects due to not having to determine requests for some shared and some non-shared resources. :param ctx: nova.context.Context object :param requested_resources: dict, keyed by resource class ID, of amounts being requested for that resource class :param rp_ids: List of resource provider IDs for providers that matched the requested resources """ if not rp_ids: return [], [] # Grab usage summaries for each provider and resource class requested requested_rc_ids = list(requested_resources.keys()) usages = _get_usages_by_provider_and_rc(ctx, rp_ids, requested_rc_ids) # Get a dict, keyed by resource provider internal ID, of ProviderSummary # objects for all providers summaries = _provider_summaries_from_usages(ctx, usages) # Next, build up a list of allocation requests. These allocation requests # are AllocationRequest objects, containing resource provider UUIDs, # resource class names and amounts to consume from that resource provider alloc_requests = [] for rp_id in rp_ids: rp_summary = summaries[rp_id] rp_uuid = rp_summary.resource_provider.uuid req_obj = _allocation_request_for_provider(ctx, requested_resources, rp_uuid) alloc_requests.append(req_obj) return alloc_requests, summaries.values() def _alloc_candidates_with_shared(ctx, requested_resources, rp_ids, sharing): """Returns a tuple of (allocation requests, provider summaries) for a supplied set of requested resource amounts and resource providers. The allocation requests will contain resource providers that EITHER have all the resources to satisfy each requested resource amount OR have can satisfy some of the requested resources AND are associated by aggregate to a resource provider that shares the missing resources with it. :param ctx: nova.context.Context object :param requested_resources: dict, keyed by resource class ID, of amounts being requested for that resource class :param rp_ids: List of resource provider IDs for providers that EITHER match all of the requested resources or are associated with sharing providers that can satisfy missing requested resources :param sharing: dict, keyed by resource class ID, of a set of resource provider IDs that share that resource class """ if not rp_ids: return [], [] # We need to grab usage information for all the providers identified as # potentially fulfilling part of the resource request. This includes # non-sharing providers returned from the above call to either # _get_all_with_shared() or _get_provider_ids_matching_all() as well as all # the providers of shared resources. Here, we simply grab a unique set of # all those resource provider internal IDs by set union'ing them together all_rp_ids = set(rp_ids) for rps in sharing.values(): all_rp_ids |= set(rps) # Grab usage summaries for each provider (local or sharing) and resource # class requested requested_rc_ids = list(requested_resources.keys()) usages = _get_usages_by_provider_and_rc(ctx, all_rp_ids, requested_rc_ids) # Get a dict, keyed by resource provider internal ID, of ProviderSummary # objects for all providers involved in the request summaries = _provider_summaries_from_usages(ctx, usages) # Next, build up a list of allocation requests. These allocation requests # are AllocationRequest objects, containing resource provider UUIDs, # resource class names and amounts to consume from that resource provider alloc_requests = [] # Build a dict, keyed by resource class ID, of AllocationRequestResource # objects that represent each resource provider for a shared resource sharing_resource_requests = _shared_allocation_request_resources( ctx, requested_resources, sharing, summaries) for rp_id in rp_ids: if rp_id not in summaries: # This resource provider is not providing any resources that have # been requested. This means that this resource provider has some # requested resources shared *with* it but the allocation of the # requested resource will not be made against it. Since this # provider won't actually have an allocation request written for # it, we just ignore it and continue continue rp_summary = summaries[rp_id] rp_uuid = rp_summary.resource_provider.uuid local_resources = set( rc_id for rc_id in requested_resources.keys() if _RC_CACHE.string_from_id(rc_id) in [ res.resource_class for res in rp_summary.resources ] ) shared_resources = set( rc_id for rc_id in requested_resources.keys() if _RC_CACHE.string_from_id(rc_id) not in [ res.resource_class for res in rp_summary.resources ] ) # Determine if the non-sharing provider actually has all the # resources requested. If not, we need to add an AllocationRequest # alternative containing this resource for each sharing provider has_all = len(shared_resources) == 0 if has_all: req = _allocation_request_for_provider(ctx, requested_resources, rp_uuid) alloc_requests.append(req) continue has_none = len(local_resources) == 0 if has_none: # This resource provider doesn't actually provide any requested # resource. It only has requested resources shared *with* it. # We do not list this provider in allocation_requests but do # list it in provider_summaries. continue # add an AllocationRequest that includes resources from the # non-sharing provider AND shared resources from each sharing # provider of that resource class non_shared_resources = local_resources - shared_resources non_shared_requests = [ AllocationRequestResource( ctx, resource_provider=ResourceProvider(ctx, uuid=rp_uuid), resource_class=_RC_CACHE.string_from_id(rc_id), amount=amount, ) for rc_id, amount in requested_resources.items() if rc_id in non_shared_resources ] sharing_request_tuples = zip( sharing_resource_requests[shared_rc_id] for shared_rc_id in shared_resources ) # sharing_request_tuples will now contain a list of tuples with the # tuples being AllocationRequestResource objects for each provider # of a shared resource for shared_request_tuple in sharing_request_tuples: shared_requests = list(*shared_request_tuple) resource_requests = non_shared_requests + shared_requests req = AllocationRequest(ctx, resource_requests=resource_requests) alloc_requests.append(req) return alloc_requests, summaries.values() # resources and more efficiently construct the allocation requests rp_ids = _get_provider_ids_matching_all(context, resources) return _alloc_candidates_no_shared(context, resources, rp_ids) # rp_ids contains a list of resource provider IDs that EITHER have all # the requested resources themselves OR have some resources and are # related to a provider that is sharing some resources with it. In # other words, this is the list of resource provider IDs that are NOT # sharing resources. rp_ids = [r[0] for r in _get_all_with_shared(context, resources)] return _alloc_candidates_with_shared(context, resources, rp_ids, sharing_providers)
deleted_lines: # resources non_sharing_rp_ids = _get_provider_ids_matching_all( context, resources) else: # We get the list of resource providers that either have the # requested resources or are associated with the providers that # share one or more of the requested resource(s) non_sharing_rp_ids = [r[0] for r in _get_all_with_shared( context, resources)] # non_sharing_rp_ids contains a list of resource provider IDs that # EITHER have all the requested resources themselves OR have some # resources and are related to a provider that is sharing some # resources with it. In other words, this is the list of resource # provider IDs that are NOT sharing resources. if not non_sharing_rp_ids: return [], [] # We need to grab usage information for all the providers identified as # potentially fulfilling part of the resource request. This includes # non-sharing providers returned from the above call to either # _get_all_with_shared() or _get_provider_ids_matching_all() as well as # all the providers of shared resources. Here, we simply grab a unique # set of all those resource provider internal IDs by set union'ing them # together all_rp_ids = set(non_sharing_rp_ids) for rps in sharing_providers.values(): all_rp_ids |= set(rps) # Grab usage summaries for each provider (local or sharing) and # resource class requested usages = _get_usages_by_provider_and_rc( context, all_rp_ids, list(resources.keys()), ) # Get a dict, keyed by resource provider internal ID, of # ProviderSummary objects for all providers involved in the request summaries = _provider_summaries_from_usages(context, usages) # Next, build up a list of allocation requests. These allocation # requests are AllocationRequest objects, containing resource provider # UUIDs, resource class names and amounts to consume from that resource # provider alloc_request_objs = [] # Build a dict, keyed by resource class ID, of # AllocationRequestResource objects that represent each resource # provider for a shared resource sharing_resource_requests = _shared_allocation_request_resources( context, resources, sharing_providers, summaries) for rp_id in non_sharing_rp_ids: if rp_id not in summaries: # This resource provider is not providing any resources that # have been requested. This means that this resource provider # has some requested resources shared *with* it but the # allocation of the requested resource will not be made against # it. Since this provider won't actually have an allocation # request written for it, we just ignore it and continue continue rp_summary = summaries[rp_id] rp_uuid = rp_summary.resource_provider.uuid local_resources = set( rc_id for rc_id in resources.keys() if _RC_CACHE.string_from_id(rc_id) in [ res.resource_class for res in rp_summary.resources ] ) shared_resources = set( rc_id for rc_id in resources.keys() if _RC_CACHE.string_from_id(rc_id) not in [ res.resource_class for res in rp_summary.resources ] ) # Determine if the root provider actually has all the resources # requested. If not, we need to add an AllocationRequest # alternative containing this resource for each sharing provider has_all = len(shared_resources) == 0 if has_all: req_obj = _allocation_request_for_provider(context, resources, rp_uuid) alloc_request_objs.append(req_obj) continue has_none = len(local_resources) == 0 if has_none: # This resource provider doesn't actually provide any requested # resource. It only has requested resources shared *with* it. # We do not list this provider in allocation_requests but do # list it in provider_summaries. continue # If there are no resource providers sharing resources involved in # this request, there's no point building a set of allocation # requests that involve resource providers other than the "root # providers" that have all the local resources on them if not sharing_resource_requests: continue # add an AllocationRequest that includes local resources from the # root provider and shared resources from each sharing provider of # that resource class non_shared_resources = local_resources - shared_resources non_shared_requests = [ AllocationRequestResource( context, resource_provider=ResourceProvider( context, uuid=rp_uuid, ), resource_class=_RC_CACHE.string_from_id(rc_id), amount=amount, ) for rc_id, amount in resources.items() if rc_id in non_shared_resources ] sharing_request_tuples = zip( sharing_resource_requests[shared_rc_id] for shared_rc_id in shared_resources ) # sharing_request_tuples will now contain a list of tuples with the # tuples being AllocationRequestResource objects for each provider # of a shared resource for shared_request_tuple in sharing_request_tuples: shared_requests = list(*shared_request_tuple) resource_requests = non_shared_requests + shared_requests req_obj = AllocationRequest( context, resource_requests=resource_requests, ) alloc_request_objs.append(req_obj) return alloc_request_objs, summaries.values()

commit_message:
Constraint ansible installation

Rally installs ansible, in an unconstrained way.

To pass linters, we skip the lint job on the test
shell command.

Change-Id: Ic830cf81b3cc691aafb7a97819e0ce68e48dd809
(cherry picked from commit 6fd0163fdac16867cb1fe93278ed0fb8acf9d743)

commit_message:
Fix rpm group for documentation subpackages

There needs to be at least two entries in a group, toplevel
groups are not allwed within SUSE.

Change-Id: Ida5d6a7ff3c9eef02f55db367b107432d1888686

commit_message:
Fix force parameter for os-quota-sets API

Add support for the "force" parameter back into the
"PUT os-quota-sets" API which was regressed in the 2.36 microversion.

APIImpact

Spec for blueprint fix-os-quota-sets-force

Change-Id: I54dc746f0d930f893490a7a13f80bb8a050a2b5f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/05/522305/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================= Fix force parameter for os-quota-sets API ========================================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/fix-os-quota-sets-force Add support for the `force` parameter back into the ``PUT os-quota-sets`` API which was regressed in the 2.36 microversion. Problem description =================== The ``PUT /os-quota-sets`` API has a `force` parameter which allows updating quotas even if the usage is in conflict. For example, this allows changing a project's quota for `instances` to 5 even if the current usage is 10. This allows admins to set a desired state for the quota even though it does not match the current usage. There was a mistake in the implementation of the 2.36 microversion where the `force` parameter was not included in the 2.36 API request schema [1]_. So any ``PUT /os-quota-sets`` request with microversion >= 2.36 that includes the `force` parameter will fail with a `400 Bad Request` response due to schema validation failing. Use Cases --------- As an admin, I want to be able to force quota limit updates for a project regardless of current usage. Proposed change =============== Simply add the `force` parameter back to the ``PUT /os-quota-sets`` request schema in a new microversion. Alternatives ------------ We could easily fix this with a one-line change to add the `force` parameter back to the request schema, but that is interoperable since some clouds would support the `force` parameter at microversion >= 2.36 if they had the fix, while others would not. We have also `precedent`_ for a fix like this using a new microversion. .. _precedent: https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ocata/implemented/fix-tag-attribute-disappearing.html Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- Add the `force` parameter back into the ``PUT /os-quota-sets`` request schema. Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- The ``--force`` option in the ``nova quota-update`` CLI and related python binding API will need to be changed to only be supported between microversion 2.1 and 2.35, and then again after the new microversion for this blueprint which adds the support back in. Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Upgrade impact -------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Matt Riedemann <mriedem.os@gmail.com> (mriedem) Other contributors: None Work Items ---------- * Update the compute API reference and python-novaclient for the current limitation, which may be backported to stable branches. * Fix the bug by adding the `force` parameter back into the ``PUT /os-quota-sets`` API request schema. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= This bug was discovered because of a lack of functional API sample testing for the ``PUT /os-quota-sets`` API at the 2.36 microversion. Simply adding that test exhibits the regression, so that will be added back in, plus new tests for the new microversion to show the `force` flag works again. Negative unit tests can be added to show the `force` flag is not accepted between 2.36 and up to but not including the new microversion. Documentation Impact ==================== The compute API reference will need to document the limitation and support that is added back in for this parameter with the new microversion. We will also likely want to put out a "known issue" release note for the existing problem and backport that release note to stable branches. References ========== .. [1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/f69d98ea744bc13189b17ba4c67e4f0279d2f45a/nova/api/openstack/compute/schemas/quota_sets.py#L47 https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1733886 History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Queens - Introduced

commit_message:
Allow pre-installed DLRN

https://review.openstack.org/498074 switched DLRN installation to
"pip install". However, it lost the ability to use a pre-installed
DLRN, which is useful for DLRN itself and used in a CI job to avoid
breaking TripleO with DLRN changes [1].

This change adds this option back, using a task variable
(dlrn_pre_installed, false by default).

[1] - https://softwarefactory-project.io/r/gitweb?p=config.git;a=blob;f=jobs-zuul/dlrn.yaml;h=21fd858b6b16ead6cd84850f2614fe3ee0f11f9f;hb=refs/heads/master#l113

Change-Id: Iee0d0cf3d7e3213aa14f91edd2e16afd3b3c8306
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras refs/changes/17/499117/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: when: not dlrn_pre_installed when: not dlrn_pre_installed - name: Pip install pre-installed DLRN shell: > source {{ build_repo_dir }}/dlrn-venv/bin/activate; pip install -r requirements.txt; python setup.py install; args: chdir: '{{ build_repo_dir }}/DLRN' when: dlrn_pre_installed - not dlrn_pre_installed

commit_message:
Add support for worker service

This enables the worker service to be running.

Change-Id: I492b61f5eb07d2c3039c8bb0f3e99626399bba62
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-designate refs/changes/04/518504/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # # Unit tests for designate::worker # require 'spec_helper' describe 'designate::worker' do let :params do { } end let :params_all do { :manage_package => true, :package_ensure => 'present', :worker_package_name => nil, :enabled => true, :service_ensure => 'running', :workers => 10, :threads => 900, :threshold_percentage => 90, :poll_timeout => 15, :poll_retry_interval => 10, :poll_max_retries => 5, :poll_detay => 1, :worker_notify => true, :export_synchronous => true, :worker_topic => 'topic', } end shared_examples 'designate-worker' do context 'with default parameters' do it { is_expected.to contain_class('designate::worker') } it 'installs designate-worker package and service' do is_expected.to contain_service('designate-worker').with( :name => platform_params[:worker_service_name], :ensure => 'running', :enable => 'true', :tag => ['openstack', 'designate-service'], ) is_expected.to contain_package('designate-worker').with( :name => platform_params[:worker_package_name], :ensure => 'present', :tag => ['openstack', 'designate-package'], ) end it 'configures designate-worker with default parameters' do is_expected.to contain_designate_config('service:worker/workers').with_value( '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' ) is_expected.to contain_designate_config('service:worker/threads').with_value( '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' ) is_expected.to contain_designate_config('service:worker/threshold_percentage').with_value( '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' ) is_expected.to contain_designate_config('service:worker/poll_timeout').with_value( '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' ) is_expected.to contain_designate_config('service:worker/poll_retry_interval').with_value( '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' ) is_expected.to contain_designate_config('service:worker/poll_max_retries').with_value( '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' ) is_expected.to contain_designate_config('service:worker/poll_delay').with_value( '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' ) is_expected.to contain_designate_config('service:worker/notify').with_value( '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' ) is_expected.to contain_designate_config('service:worker/export_synchronous').with_value( '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' ) is_expected.to contain_designate_config('service:worker/worker_topic').with_value( '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' ) end end context 'with custom package name' do before do params.merge!({ :worker_package_name => 'designate-worker-custom-name' }) end it 'configures using custom name' do is_expected.to contain_package('designate-worker').with( :name => 'designate-worker-custom-name', :ensure => 'present', :tag => ['openstack', 'designate-package'], ) end end context 'with all params' do before do params.merge!( params_all ) end it 'configures designate-worker with all parameters' do is_expected.to contain_designate_config('service:worker/workers').with_value( params[:workers] ) is_expected.to contain_designate_config('service:worker/threads').with_value( params[:threads] ) is_expected.to contain_designate_config('service:worker/threshold_percentage').with_value( params[:threshold_percentage] ) is_expected.to contain_designate_config('service:worker/poll_timeout').with_value( params[:poll_timeout] ) is_expected.to contain_designate_config('service:worker/poll_retry_interval').with_value( params[:poll_retry_interval] ) is_expected.to contain_designate_config('service:worker/poll_max_retries').with_value( params[:poll_max_retries] ) is_expected.to contain_designate_config('service:worker/poll_delay').with_value( params[:poll_delay] ) is_expected.to contain_designate_config('service:worker/notify').with_value( params[:worker_notify] ) is_expected.to contain_designate_config('service:worker/export_synchronous').with_value( params[:export_synchronous] ) is_expected.to contain_designate_config('service:worker/worker_topic').with_value( params[:worker_topic] ) end end end on_supported_os({ :supported_os => OSDefaults.get_supported_os }).each do |os,facts| context "on #{os}" do let (:facts) do facts.merge!(OSDefaults.get_facts()) end let(:platform_params) do case facts[:osfamily] when 'Debian' { :worker_package_name => 'designate-worker', :worker_service_name => 'designate-worker' } when 'RedHat' { :worker_package_name => 'openstack-designate-worker', :worker_service_name => 'designate-worker' } end end it_behaves_like 'designate-worker' end end end

subject: run_tests_common.sh: Add more openSUSE packages
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-11-27 16:19:43.000000000', 'files': ['run_tests_common.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-tests/commit/c28727540d3c9ed0641d5052c67b4500aac330e9', 'message': 'run_tests_common.sh: Add more openSUSE packages

We need to explicitly pull the python-xml and ca-certificates-mozilla
packages which may not exist on really small openSUSE images. These

able to run pip.

Change-Id: Ib518cff03dbfdbfa7c31729521c265e7a3e7e9cf
'}]
commit_message:
run_tests_common.sh: Add more openSUSE packages

We need to explicitly pull the python-xml and ca-certificates-mozilla
packages which may not exist on really small openSUSE images. These
packages are needed for a functional SSL setup and also for being
able to run pip.

Change-Id: Ib518cff03dbfdbfa7c31729521c265e7a3e7e9cf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-tests refs/changes/60/523160/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sudo zypper -n in ca-certificates-mozilla python-devel \ python-xml lsb-release ${extra_suse_deps:-}

commit_message:
Change haproxy check to tcpka for ec2_api

EC2-API always returns HTTP code 400 if not properly authorized,
therefore httpchk is not working, since it's expecting an 200 OK.
Changing to tcpka for now, until EC2-API implements a URL that is
suitable for healthchecks.

Change-Id: Ic8ec8cdd4dc59e3768c06912ceb8a91b425b0a06

commit_message:
Fix wrong logic for triggering os-net-config special handling.

We want the special upgrade to be trigger when the
os_net_config_need_upgrade is true.

Change-Id: I6da13ad8bc9675ea2a80006615f4dc98355182f9
Closes-Bug: #1734135
(cherry picked from commit fac92ba0e7c4e40db73864e44c81a17cdfad2325)

commit_message:
Added options central service

This patch adds workers, threads, default-pool-id options to the
central.pp as these options can be configured for designate-central.

Change-Id: I0635d5fd2ece7bca85fab772a055c999d6721c1a
Closes-Bug: #1539327
Co-Authored-By: Sharat Sharma <sharat.sharma@nectechnologies.in>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-designate refs/changes/96/518496/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*workers*] # (optional) Number of central worker processes to spawn. # Defaults to $::os_workers # # [*threads*] # (optional) Number of central greenthreads to spawn. # Defaults to $::os_service_default # # [*default_pool_id*] # (optional) The name of the default pool. # Defaults to $::os_service_default # $workers = $::os_workers, $threads = $::os_service_default, $default_pool_id = $::os_service_default, 'service:central/workers' : value => $workers; 'service:central/threads' : value => $threads; 'service:central/default_pool_id' : value => $default_pool_id;

commit_message:
Add ansible deploy interface

this patch pulls the ansible deploy interface code
and related ansible playbooks and auxiliary files
from ironic-staging-drivers project into main ironic tree.

As discussed in the spec, the use of ramdisk callbacks
(lookup and hearbeats) is now mandatory with this deploy interface.
Playbooks and modules were updated to require Ansible>=2.4,
and custom Ansible module for executing 'parted' was replaced
with usage of built-in Ansible module.

The custom Ansible callback plugin now uses journald logger
by default to adapt to the default DevStack setup.

Documentation and devstack plugin changes enabling automated
testing of this interface will be proposed in followup patches.

Change-Id: I43f54688287953ccb1c2836437aea76236e6560b
Related-Bug: #1526308
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/22/510522/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - include: mounts.yaml when: "{{ ironic.image.type | default('whole-disk-image') == 'partition' }}" - include: grub.yaml when: "{{ ironic.image.type | default('whole-disk-image') == 'partition' }}"

subject: [ci] Use pseudo-random names for new resources

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-03 10:42:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient/commit/05da2d42c4424d6b669090e831c168eed57d708d', 'message': '[ci] Use pseudo-random names for new resources

It is hard to find a test which do not clean resources after execution
if resources have complitely random names. This patch changes
name_generate method to include test name, which can be really helpful.

commit_message:
[ci] Use pseudo-random names for new resources

Random names of resources makes the task impossible to find a test which
doesn't clean resources after a launch.

This patch changes name_generate method to generate names including a name
of the test, which can be really helpful.

Also, the simple script that prints resources after test run is added.

Change-Id: Id3a743afb624dd4bf8ed3523a1916455fd93655a

commit_message:
ovb: run ovb-containers-oooq only on pike

ovb-ha is now deployed on containers starting from queens.
we don't want ovb-containers-oooq anymore in queens and beyond.

commit_message:
Make ovb-manage-stack role usable for upstream reproducers

Currently the ovb-manage-stack role does not have any way to
setup a non-root user and no way to dump an inventory file. This
works fine when used with the rest of quickstart, because we have
other code that does these things.

However in order to reproduce tripleo-ci OVB jobs we want to
simply provision an environment like tebroker does in those jobs.
Then we just hand that environment off to the tripleo-ci job
scripts.

This change adds two optional bits (both off by default) that will
add a non-root user and dump an inventory file.

Change-Id: I9ee4402572583d6acb7cfdbde79b4b2e41a53fdf

commit_message:
Update release cadence

Charms have moved back to a 3 monthly cadence, with every other
release being aligned to the main OpenStack release.

Change-Id: I834a491a831e138b8a111819a9b5ebec10cba95b

commit_message:
Expose a bug when create trust with roles

The test here should pass with 400 Bad Request because
that there is no valid roles in the request body.
But Keystone raise 500 error because that it doesn't
check the roles key.

Partial-Bug: #1734244
Change-Id: Ic007c8f83717aa69ecb831d460a3829d3f8f1a6d

added_lines: from keystone.tests.unit import utils as test_utils @test_utils.wip('Waiting on validation to be added from fixing bug1734244') def test_create_trust_with_non_existant_role_id_or_name_returns_forbidden( self): ref = unit.new_trust_ref(trustor_user_id=self.user_id, trustee_user_id=self.trustee_user_id, project_id=self.project_id) ref.update({'roles': {'fake_key': 'fake_value'}}) # Keystone should return 403 Forbidden, because there is project but no # valid role in the request body. self.post('/OS-TRUST/trusts', body={'trust': ref}, expected_status=http_client.FORBIDDEN)

commit_message:
Fixed helm_dry_run path issue

Fixed the calculation of WORK_DIR so that the script can be
invoked by itself (as opposed to part of the overall gate scripts,
which works fine).

Change-Id: Ib7d07978965d3401725c7766754bbaff2f535a5a

commit_message:
Release tempest 17.2.0

Nothing major inside, but since it updates some requirements, minor
version is bumped.

Note: my personal rationale to trigger the new release is to include
latest fixes to in-tree tempest tests. AFAIU it should be fine to
trigger a new release at any point in time.

Change-Id: I7ccbbefb1fe7e83ccc9f12710be671bd25e71bb9

commit_message:
test-log-collect.sh: Collect package and repository info on Ubuntu

The script supports collecting information for packages and
repositories for openSUSE and CentOS but not for Ubuntu so add the
appropriate commands for it. This also fixes some indentation issues.

Change-Id: I9a2eca110cdf6d1186c867b5bb632ba48580f070

commit_message:
Add more logging for software deployment updates

Include the server ID in existing logs, and add additional logs that will
let us know when updates to software deployments have happened and whether
they have succeeded or not. This should save considerable time
investigating in the future if there's ever any question of whether a
deployment has gone missing in Heat itself or somewhere on the target
server.

Change-Id: I33d7aee5974d03b7e41beab9fef4ad643cb0c469

commit_message:
Move back to docker-site.yaml for ceph ansible update

The rolling-update for ceph ansible is broken now,
so we have to switch to the docker site playbook
instead

Closes-Bug: 1734307
Change-Id: I41f638b0a7df903bd95ab8d42241249d6ec1043a
(cherry picked from commit 1020a23ae9475a492fb81a1593a911b0bd16ef11)

commit_message:
config: Always add step conditional first for upgrade_tasks

This is required to ensure conditionals using variables set by prior
steps are not evaluated prior to these steps running.

Closes-bug: #1732888
Change-Id: I9f6d60f22ef4c057a0d5f47ac2bd4f08520faeec

commit_message:
Set ceph_use_fqdn for rdocloud

Multinode deployments on rdocloud make the hostname *.rdocloud.
This means that we need to pass an extra argument to ceph-ansible
in order to have ceph-mon configured correctly.

The actual logic for this option is implemented in the depends-on
patch.

Change-Id: Id9668b340cb97cc309bd1618a25b0936b8d54113
Depends-On: I79cb56a10b4dd60c7bb7bab40bbdc5711f61f27b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/44/519744/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ceph_use_fqdn: true

subject: Handle 'false' in when statements for ansible upgrade_tasks
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-11-23 12:44:52.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_common/utils/config.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common/commit/2a9012a3f0ffcac7d946581b68f14daf118939c3', 'message': 'Handle 'false' in when statements for ansible upgrade_tasks

The upgrade_task that remove packages have a when clause that is
set from the UpgradeRemoveUnusedPackages parameter. When we write
the overcloud config and translate "tags: step" to "when: step"
we must be careful to handle these tasks otherwise we get errors.
See the bug for more info.

Change-Id: Ic10ae0f3262a93ceec6ba8d938f36c937f3b594c
Closes-Bug: 1734118
'}]
commit_message:
Handle 'false' in when statements for ansible upgrade_tasks

The upgrade_task that remove packages have a when clause that is
set from the UpgradeRemoveUnusedPackages parameter. When we write
the overcloud config and translate "tags: step" to "when: step"
we must be careful to handle these tasks otherwise we get errors.
See the bug for more info.

Change-Id: Ic10ae0f3262a93ceec6ba8d938f36c937f3b594c
Closes-Bug: 1734118
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/39/522539/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if whenexpr is None: task.update({"when": "step|int == %s" % step}) else: when_exists = re.search('step|int == [0-9]', "%s" % w)
deleted_lines: if whenexpr: when_exists = re.search('step|int == [0-9]', w) else: task.update({"when": "step|int == %s" % step})

commit_message:
Stop the object-expirer service before removing swift-proxy

As discussed in the bug below, the expirer service is provided
by the swift-proxy package so it needs to be stopped at the
same time as swift-proxy and not with the other swift services

Change-Id: I01518f82cef494682b4359ba7849ba7e37ac39cc
Related-Bug: 1701501
(cherry picked from commit b3d1d45ba5cd0d608b514cca9aaa53eb6ddc45e8)

deleted_lines: - name: Check if swift_proxy is deployed command: systemctl is-enabled --quiet openstack-swift-proxy register: swift_proxy_enabled - name: "PreUpgrade step0,validation: Check service openstack-swift-proxy is running" command: systemctl is-active --quiet openstack-swift-proxy when: swift_proxy_enabled.rc == 0 - name: Stop and disable swift_proxy service service: name=openstack-swift-proxy state=stopped enabled=no

commit_message:
Implement query param schema for flavor index

GET flavor API accept query param to filter the
flavors.
This commit adds json schema to validate the valid
query parameters.

There is no change in API behaviour and additionalProperties
is kept True for backward compatibility.

Partially implements blueprint json-schema-validation-for-query-param

Change-Id: I61324ba58eddfed1445d7c70db761961e1b6a864

commit_message:
Remove the ensure_dir

The utils.file.ensure_dir is deprecated for removal in version Ocata.
ensure_tree(path, 0o755) from the oslo_utils.fileutils can be used
instead.

Depends-On: Ic9b4b86e65052c06c33c8628bb0c6700cdfd875b
Change-Id: Ifff970d80acb7ef28cb7fc67d3ae0c5524de1bc3
Closes-Bug: #1733757

commit_message:
zuul: run TripleO jobs with new zuulv3 layout

Configure the layout to execute the scenario007 jobs.
Note that baremetal job will be run on stable/pike and container on
Queens and beyond.

A note has been added in comment explaining more details.

Change-Id: I61e9d316ad283076a735344635cbcb227ee0de09
Depends-On: I8f8f0ce918d83cc99792cb0554ec081d4c3bc20b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/52/521152/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # TripleO jobs that deploy OVN. # Note we don't use a project-template here, so it's easier # to disable voting on one specific job if things go wrong. # tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario007-multinode-oooq will only # run on stable/pike while the -container will run in Queens # and beyond. # If you need any support to debug these jobs in case of # failures, please reach us on #tripleo IRC channel. - tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario007-multinode-oooq - tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario007-multinode-oooq-container - tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario007-multinode-oooq - tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario007-multinode-oooq-container

commit_message:
Add py35 gate for ironic-inspector

This patch adds py35 gate for ironic-inspector and
also adds support for inspection in python3 environment
by rolling out configuration of swift in inspector.

commit_message:
Setting default log url for tempestmail

Tempestmail needs to know in which url the logs are stored.
By default it uses logs.openstack.org, however, since these jobs are
being executed in rdo-cloud and logs stored in a different server, this
set is required when the email is send point to the proper url.

Change-Id: I9ccb073da4485a1d0fc9fe6ae8cca3d36dd6f081
Depends-On: Iab9b448551d1a2ed59b47f91d5a9bcc204e0a703

commit_message:
Adding the possibility to pass the log url to tempestmail

Tempestmail is being used in other CI that don't work like the
openstack upstream ci, and logs are stored somewhere else.
This patch allows the possibility to pass --log-url option
to tempestmail script override the default log path.

Change-Id: Iab9b448551d1a2ed59b47f91d5a9bcc204e0a703

commit_message:
ironic: rework enrollment with the recent changes

* Explain resource classes and add them to post-configuration commands
* Explain inventory fields thay may not be obvious
* Mention that host aggregates won't be needed in Queens
* Add more ways to validate that ironic services run and report properly
* Small fixes here and there

Note that the complete switch to resource classes is still in progress
in Queens, so the guide still defaults to Pike-era configuration.

Change-Id: I453912dde1e660c49cd889650b19e4bb80201b0b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-docs refs/changes/67/510867/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Essential configuration ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ The following parameters should be configured in advance for overcloud Ironic in an environment file (``ironic-config.yaml`` in this guide). * ``IronicEnabledHardwareTypes`` configures which hardware types will be supported in Ironic. .. note:: Hardware types are the new generation of Ironic drivers. For example, the ``ipmi`` hardware type roughly corresponds to the ``pxe_ipmitool`` driver. Check `driver configuration guide`_ and `driver-specific documentation`_ for more details. Some drivers might require additional configuration to work properly. Check `driver configuration guide`_ and `driver-specific documentation`_ for more details. By default, the ``ipmi`` hardware type is enabled. .. admonition:: Stable Branches :class: stable The following options can be used before the Pike release: * ``IronicEnabledDrivers`` parameter sets the list of enabled drivers. The most often used bare metal driver is ``pxe_ipmitool``. Also enabled by default are ``pxe_ilo`` and ``pxe_drac`` drivers. .. admonition:: Virtual :class: virtual Starting with the Ocata release, testing on a virtual environment requires using :doc:`../environments/virtualbmc`. Before the Ocata release, a separate ``pxe_ssh`` driver has to be enabled for virtual testing, for example:: parameter_defaults: IronicEnabledDrivers: - pxe_ssh If you used **tripleo-quickstart** to build your environment, the resulting configuration is a bit different:: parameter_defaults: IronicEnabledDrivers: - pxe_ssh ControllerExtraConfig: ironic::drivers::ssh::libvirt_uri: 'qemu:///session' - ComputeFilter - ComputeCapabilitiesFilter - ImagePropertiesFilter .. admonition:: Stable Branches :class: stable Before the Pike release, include also Ram and Disk filters:: parameter_defaults: NovaSchedulerDefaultFilters: - RetryFilter - AggregateInstanceExtraSpecsFilter - AvailabilityZoneFilter For a deployment with **only** bare metal hosts you might want to replace the filters with their ``Exact`` counterparts. In such case the scheduler will require a strict match between bare metal nodes and flavors. Otherwise, any bare metal node with higher or equal specs would match. :: parameter_defaults: NovaSchedulerDefaultFilters: - RetryFilter - AvailabilityZoneFilter - ExactRamFilter - ExactDiskFilter - ExactCoreFilter - ComputeFilter - ComputeCapabilitiesFilter - ImagePropertiesFilter.. _driver configuration guide: https://docs.openstack.org/ironic/latest/install/enabling-drivers.html .. _driver-specific documentation: https://docs.openstack.org/ironic/latest/admin/drivers.html Additional configuration ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Deployment ~~~~~~~~~~ To deploy Ironic in containers (starting with the Pike release), use ``/usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates/environments/services-docker/ironic.yaml`` instead. Validation ~~~~~~~~~~Post-deployment configuration ----------------------------- In this section we configure OpenStack for both bare metal and virtual machines provisioning. This guide, however, uses one network for simplicity. If you encounter weird DHCP, PXE or networking issues with such a single-network configuration, try shutting down the introspection DHCP server on the undercloud after the initial introspection is finished:: sudo systemctl stop openstack-ironic-inspector-dnsmasq Resource classes ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Starting with the Pike release, bare metal instances are scheduled based on *custom resource classes*. In case of Ironic, a resource class will correspond to a flavor. When planning your bare metal cloud, think of a way to split all nodes into classes, and create flavors accordingly. See `bare metal flavor documentation`_ for more details. .. _bare metal flavor documentation: https://docs.openstack.org/ironic/latest/install/configure-nova-flavors.html Starting with the Pike release, switch to scheduling based on resource classes, as explained in the `bare metal flavor documentation`_:: openstack flavor set baremetal --property resources:CUSTOM_BAREMETAL=1 openstack flavor set baremetal --property resources:VCPU=0 openstack flavor set baremetal --property resources:MEMORY_MB=0 openstack flavor set baremetal --property resources:DISK_GB=0 resource_class: baremetalovercloud`_. The ``resource_class`` field corresponds to a custom resource class, as explained in `Resource classes`_.
deleted_lines: This guide, however, uses one network for simplicity. If you encounter weird DHCP, PXE or networking issues with such a single-network configuration, try shutting down the introspection DHCP server on the undercloud after the initial introspection is finished:: sudo systemctl stop openstack-ironic-inspector-dnsmasq A few things can be configured in advance for overcloud Ironic in an environment file (``ironic-config.yaml`` in this guide): * ``IronicEnabledDrivers`` parameter sets the list of enabled drivers. The most often used bare metal driver is ``pxe_ipmitool``. Also enabled by default are ``pxe_ilo`` and ``pxe_drac`` drivers. Other drivers might require additional configuration to work properly. Check `driver configuration guide`_ and `driver-specific documentation`_ for more details. .. admonition:: Virtual :class: virtual Starting with the Ocata release, testing on a virtual environment requires using :doc:`../environments/virtualbmc`. .. admonition:: Stable Branches :class: stable Before the Ocata release, a separate ``pxe_ssh`` driver has to be enabled for virtual testing, for example:: parameter_defaults: IronicEnabledDrivers: - pxe_ssh If you used **tripleo-quickstart** to build your environment, the resulting configuration is a bit different:: parameter_defaults: IronicEnabledDrivers: - pxe_ssh ControllerExtraConfig: ironic::drivers::ssh::libvirt_uri: 'qemu:///session' * ``IronicEnabledHardwareTypes`` is available since the Pike release, and allows setting enabled hardware types - the new generation of Ironic drivers. Check `driver configuration guide`_ and `driver-specific documentation`_ for more details. By default, the ``ipmi`` hardware type is enabled, and its defaults roughly correspond to ones of the ``pxe_ipmitool`` driver (more precisely, of the ``pxe_ipmitool_socat`` driver). For a deployment with **only** bare metal hosts you might want to replace some filters with their ``Exact`` counterparts. In such case the scheduler will require a strict match between bare metal nodes and flavors. Otherwise, any bare metal node with higher or equal specs would match. :: parameter_defaults: NovaSchedulerDefaultFilters: - RetryFilter - AvailabilityZoneFilter - ExactRamFilter - ExactDiskFilter - ExactCoreFilter - ComputeFilter - ComputeCapabilitiesFilter - ImagePropertiesFilter.. _driver configuration guide: https://docs.openstack.org/project-install-guide/baremetal/draft/enabling-drivers.html .. _driver-specific documentation: https://docs.openstack.org/developer/ironic/deploy/drivers.html ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~overcloud`_. export OS_BAREMETAL_API_VERSION=1.11

commit_message:
More messages about validating token failed

If a token has expired, the response is just 'Failed to validate token'
without the specific reason about it.

Change-Id: I61d97e3acfb899adf2977c4ec3d4a30b2df18fd9

subject: Added filtering of empty extra properties
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-17 12:01:22.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/common/sql/core.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/common/test_sql_core.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/44a8ae454ae45162a949e6916c01f71b3363f90d', 'message': "Added filtering of empty extra properties

Keystone doesn't allow to delete extra properties. We can unset
their values: the same operation as to set property value to None
(according to action presented in V2), but keystone will continue
store these properties in DB and return them with None values.
This behavior significantly influences on UX, when user activelly
uses these fields to mark/unmark project (users, roles, domains),
because it leads to mess in an output of CLI or UI.

This patch adds filtering of empty properties to prevent cluttering
of extra field that contains custom properties for objects.

Change-Id: Idb79e422f6cf9743e37c78abdfd6a13869ef17c0
"}]
commit_message:
Added filtering of empty extra properties

Keystone doesn't allow to delete extra properties. We can unset
their values: the same operation as to set property value to None
(according to action presented in V2), but keystone will continue
store these properties in DB and return them with None values.
This behavior significantly influences on UX, when user activelly
uses these fields to mark/unmark project (users, roles, domains),
because it leads to mess in an output of CLI or UI.

This patch adds filtering of empty properties to prevent cluttering
of extra field that contains custom properties for objects.

Change-Id: Idb79e422f6cf9743e37c78abdfd6a13869ef17c0

added_lines: class TestModelDict(ModelBase, sql.DictBase): __tablename__ = 'testmodeldict' attributes = ['id', 'text'] id = sql.Column(sql.String(64), primary_key=True) text = sql.Column(sql.String(64), nullable=False) extra = sql.Column(sql.JsonBlob()) class TestModelDictBase(unit.BaseTestCase): def test_creating_a_model_instance_from_a_dict_with_null_extra(self): m = TestModelDict.from_dict( {'id': utils.new_uuid(), 'text': utils.new_uuid(), 'key1': 'val1', 'key2': None, 'key3': 'val3', 'key4': None}) expected_extra = {'key1': 'val1', 'key3': 'val3'} self.assertEqual(expected_extra, m.extra)

commit_message:
Revert "CI: remove useless templates"

This broke periodic multinode jobs. If the plan is to remove those, could we get this reverted until multinode are removed to get promotions unblocked?

This reverts commit e13c06c09c4827b1bda92b40c8264996fb04424e.

Change-Id: Iea1aa5f5d2bf7e92407171475089540206e91558

commit_message:
Polish swift containers logging configuration

The logging directories are not used by swift, which in turn logs
to syslog. So the unnecessary bind-mounts were removed.

Furthermore, as part of the swift package which is included in the
overcloud image, there is an rsyslog rule which gets the swift logs
and persists them in /var/log/swift. Due to this and to be consistent
with the rest of the containers. A symlink was created to have the
swift logs available from /var/log/containers/swift as well. This makes
the readme indicating the change of place of the logs unnecessary, so
that was removed as well.

Closes-Bug: #1732107
Change-Id: I61610d3cb187235ac316e1c5de0a344be3ebb1e2
(cherry picked from commit 84e9425edab83578d09fa612a1e772b188a9c3db)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/01/521501/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - /var/log/swift - name: Create swift logging symlink file: src: /var/log/swift dest: /var/log/containers/swift state: link
deleted_lines: permissions: - path: /var/log/swift owner: swift:swift recurse: true - /var/log/containers/swift:/var/log/swift - /var/log/containers/httpd/swift-proxy:/var/log/httpd - /var/log/containers/swift - /var/log/containers/httpd/swift-proxy - name: swift logs readme copy: dest: /var/log/swift/readme.txt content: | Log files from swift containers can be found under /var/log/containers/swift and /var/log/containers/httpd/swift-*. ignore_errors: true

commit_message:
Convert the legacy lxc bridge to networkd

This change implements the lxcbr0 interface in systemd-networkd. This is
being done to simplify how this bridge is setup and to unify it's
management across distros. The change removes all of the old dnsmasq
process and cleans up variables, templates, and files that are no longer
needed.

New tests have been added to create a container and ping an external
address in an effort to ensure the container build and host setup
process works as expected.

Change-Id: Ib2b9062b8290c9b3bccb1ae64806f86c818ad8b1
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-lxc_hosts refs/changes/61/478561/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # {{ ansible_managed }} BRIDGE='yes' IPADDR={{ lxc_net_address }} NETMASK={{ lxc_net_netmask }} {% if lxc_net_mtu is defined %} MTU={{ lxc_net_mtu }} {% endif %} BOOTPROTO=static STARTMODE=auto BRIDGE_STP='off' # POST_UP script POST_UP_SCRIPT="compat:suse:ifup-post-{{ lxc_net_bridge }}" # POST_DOWN script POST_DOWN_SCRIPT="compat:suse:ifdown-post-{{ lxc_net_bridge }}"

commit_message:
Api-guide: Address TODOs in user_concepts section

Address TODOs in user_concepts section

Change-Id: Ibb604a0421f13066b88c75295abe91eb4a5a5d2e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/95/522095/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Key and value pairs that define on which compute nodes a flavor can run. These paris must match corresponding pairs on the compute nodes. commit_message:
Remove use_neutron option

Nova network has been fully removed from the OpenStack codebase.
As such, all instances of switches on use_neutron should be removed,
as the functionality will never be meaningful.

Change-Id: I2eb338ba53d51c62c88bbbfd145462030596da74
Depends-On: Ib9d87dd339d637b69fb27315d92228cbc523c8eb
Closes-Bug: #1734615

commit_message:
Remove required-projects from post docs jobs

The docs job is a final job, we cannot add required-projects here.

Remove them and the job, it's part of the publish template that is used.

Note that currently no post jobs are run due to the wrong setup. This
change breaks the post job temporarily but allows the other post jobs to
run while work is ongoing on the post docs job.

Change-Id: I373f870b47b69da7b034de2b7c4912bbd4a619aa

subject: Change Conflict's error message
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-11-23 09:28:30.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/lib/exceptions.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/f312f1506d2d2fd4354b6adb90c8459882c776aa', 'message': 'Change Conflict's error message

Conflict exception's error message is sometimes misleading,
e.g.,

<class 'tempest.lib.exceptions.Conflict'>,
An object with that identifier already exists
Details: {u'message':
            u'Unable to complete operation on subnet
              98575cac-0a2f-4214-8dea-50c62d31e736:
            One or more ports have an IP allocation from this subnet.',
            u'type': u'SubnetInUse', u'detail': u''}

according to https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-6.5.8,
"The 409 (Conflict) status code indicates that the request could not
be completed due to a conflict with the current state of the target
resource", so this is to change the error message to
"Conflict with state of target resource".

Change-Id: Icc118ec67f05cc7640e2b5f12162547ae5c3dae5
'}]
commit_message:
Change Conflict's error message

Conflict exception's error message is sometimes misleading,
e.g.,

<class 'tempest.lib.exceptions.Conflict'>,
An object with that identifier already exists
Details: {u'message':
            u'Unable to complete operation on subnet
              98575cac-0a2f-4214-8dea-50c62d31e736:
            One or more ports have an IP allocation from this subnet.',
            u'type': u'SubnetInUse', u'detail': u''}

according to https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-6.5.8,
"The 409 (Conflict) status code indicates that the request could not
be completed due to a conflict with the current state of the target
resource", so this is to change the error message to
"Conflict with state of target resource".

Change-Id: Icc118ec67f05cc7640e2b5f12162547ae5c3dae5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/97/522497/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: message = "Conflict with state of target resource"
deleted_lines: message = "An object with that identifier already exists"

commit_message:
Include 'queens' as target version for upgrade.

The target_upgrade_version is not queens, so
without this change no upgrade job in master
will run a complete upgrade as the overcloud
deploy command to upgrade is not being run.

Change-Id: I8f4cfc4596c6a48a2526379e8a11aefad97c290e
Depends-On: Id53b609ff6f31e1da96598c180151239be287242
Closes-Bug: #1728917
