commit_message:
Use 'PermitRootLogin 'without-password''

Since https://review.openstack.org/#/c/518013/7 merged we can now set
the value of security_sshd_permit_root_login to be 'without-password',
we should do this in favour of 'yes'.

Change-Id: I624d29752fca5a8cbf4cab455f32f0116b99ff82

commit_message:
Performance oriented unit test for HMT

Create a project tree, then call for every project:
  - resource_api.list_projects_in_subtree()
  - resource_api.list_project_parents()

Change-Id: I26e43f929acf0f4f03a0b46c55ac7b9e46d3a543

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from keystone.common import dependency from keystone.tests.unit import core as unit_core from keystone.tests.functional import core as functional_core @dependency.requires('resource_api') class HMTPerformanceTest(functional_core.BaseTestCase): TREE_DEPTH = 5 NODE_WIDTH = 5 def setUp(self): project_ref = unit_core.new_project_ref() self.test_root = self.resource_api.create_project( project_ref['id'], project_ref) parents = [project_ref] for _ in range(self.TREE_DEPTH): leaves = [] for parent in parents: for _ in range(self.NODE_WIDTH): project_ref = unit_core.new_project_ref( parent_id=parent['id']) leaf = self.resource_api.create_project( project_ref['id'], project_ref) leaves.append(leaf) parents = leaves def test_hmt(self): for p in self.resource_api.list_projects_in_subtree( self.test_root['id']): self.resource_api.list_projects_in_subtree(p['id']) self.resource_api.list_project_parents(p['id']) def tearDown(self): for p in self.resource_api.list_projects_in_subtree( self.test_root['id']): self.resource_api.delete_project(p['id']) self.resource_api.delete_project(self.test_root['id'])

commit_message:
Allow the user to run ansible update on all nodes

Do not limit the nodes to update to the --nodes option
will allow the user to run the update on all nodes
with simply:

openstack overcloud update stack

Change-Id: I912e3881b44d4fbf78b6679deb23eb0b5f9a228d
(cherry picked from commit 73dce75602feac411c1546ea828b64d7157d0b5a)

commit_message:
Ensure os-net-config conditional for upgrade doesnt fail.

When using grep the check will fail if no upgrade is available.  This
has the side effect of not registering the variable and the check
later on will fail as .stdout property is not defined.

Using awk doesnt have this side effect and will return empty stdout
without error in case of error.

Change-Id: I9d9bb3b625c2f0fb5f4a2c98bd3bf903f4bec176
Closes-Bug: #1733924

commit_message:
Finish deprecation of pull_source

In change I0b0b8728b7752bdd4680a5a2bbf664f94f7d56d9 the --pull-source
argument was deprecated in favour of a --namespace which includes the
source registry.

This change makes the default namespace docker.io/tripleoupstream to
be consistent with the default that the CLI uses. Tests now do not use
pull_source so that proper testing of fully qualified namespace
arguments is done.

Change-Id: Icd29f0e75c3edadfb008056af774e283200002b0
Related-Bug: #1708303

commit_message:
Quota limits

Quotas are scattered across OpenStack services.
Each service defines own models and APIs for managing limits.
Because of that, there are several problems:
 - Name of the resources and resource-service mapping  are hardcoded.
 - There is no centralized quota management for OpenStack projects.
 - Cinder, Nova and Neutron support hierarchical quotas
   in different ways.
There should be a single point of managing quotas in OpenStack.
Keystone looks like a right place to store quotas limits because
Keystone stores projects and limits are belong to projects.

Change-Id: I9661e4e8ecca454d456d716475868f632d0130d1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone-specs refs/changes/65/363765/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============ Quota limits ============ `bp quota-limits <https://blueprints.launchpad.net/keystone/+spec/quota-limits>`_ Quotas are scattered across OpenStack services. Each defines own models and APIs for managing limits. Because of that, there are many differences in what is supported. There should be a single point of managing quotas in OpenStack. Problem Description =================== Now each OpenStack service manages quotas by themselves. It leads to differences in what is supported. It also slows down introduction of new concepts, such as domains and HMT. Proposed Change =============== Store quota limits in keystone. Provide API for CRUD. Provide API for fetching limits per user/project/domain and per service. Alternatives ------------ Store quotas in a separate service, managed by Keystone project. Security Impact --------------- None Notifications Impact -------------------- Notifications will be emited for any action performed on quotas. Other Deployer Impact --------------------- None Developer Impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: bbobrov Other contributors: Work Items ---------- Work items or tasks -- break the feature up into the things that need to be done to implement it. Those parts might end up being done by different people, but we're mostly trying to understand the timeline for implementation. Dependencies ============ None Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== Please add any useful references here. You are not required to have any reference. Moreover, this specification should still make sense when your references are unavailable. Examples of what you could include are: * https://review.openstack.org/#/c/40568/, https://review.openstack.org/#/c/44878/ -- old attempt to implement. * https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/CentralizedQuotas -- discussion etherpad * https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/325f99a64aeb3e7a768904781d854c19bb540580/cinder/db/sqlalchemy/models.py#L565 -- quotas model in Cinder

'prohibit-password' or 'forced-commands-only'.
This patch changes the functionality to ensure that
security_sshd_permit_root_login is one of the above settings - if so, it
will use that value.

Due to the way Ansible handles "no" and "yes", we have to check if the
value is "False" (string equivalent for boolean no), and if so output

commit_message:
Change PermitRootLogin to allow alternate options

PermitRootLogin can be 'yes', 'no', 'without-password',
'prohibit-password' or 'forced-commands-only'.
This patch changes the functionality to ensure that
security_sshd_permit_root_login is one of the above settings - if so, it
will use that value.

Due to the way Ansible handles "no" and "yes", we have to check if the
value is "False" (string equivalent for boolean no), and if so output
"no", otherwise output the string (which would be one of the above
options).

Previously, we could only set this value to 'no'.

Change-Id: I5ee5ff6abc4578d17d4b23d8a2fa1648508ceeed
(cherry picked from commit f32cb3c0817441e3ba907c6481963bdd03c869cd)

commit_message:
Fix dumps_log playbook

Currently, execution openstack.sh in the dumps_log is not performed
causing some variable in the dumps_log.sh to be empty.  Consequently,
any openstack-related logs are not captured at the end of the gate.
This patch set should fix the path issue of the openstack.sh.

Change-Id: I1d8f5733d49476e80c7fa1399f46bcd6c45198c0

commit_message:

Moved baremetal port tests to a separate file and
updated them to utilize the new testing method.

Additionally, normalized the output of the port lists as
noise is introduced that is not needed.

subject: Ignore errors in OS::stack_id output
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-09-25 19:40:55.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/template_resource.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/af0feeb18a4f5fb2c20fffb6d85617d1775e5844', 'message': 'Ignore errors in OS::stack_id output

If a provider stack contained an OS::stack_id output and there was an error
in the output, we would raise TemplateOutputError when trying to calculate
the reference ID of the facade resource. Since we do that in many API
calls, such an error could render the stack effectively unusable.

If we encounter such an error, log it and fall back to the default

Change-Id: I1bc921fe74c54eb0999541ef36afc42b9c19e9bc
Partial-Bug: #1712280
Related-Bug: #1719333
'}]
commit_message:
Ignore errors in OS::stack_id output

If a provider stack contained an OS::stack_id output and there was an error
in the output, we would raise TemplateOutputError when trying to calculate
the reference ID of the facade resource. Since we do that in many API
calls, such an error could render the stack effectively unusable.

If we encounter such an error, log it and fall back to the default
reference ID.

Change-Id: I1bc921fe74c54eb0999541ef36afc42b9c19e9bc
Partial-Bug: #1712280
Related-Bug: #1719333
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/49/507249/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove required-jobs from final docs job

We cannot modify the final job, remove the required-jobs. This will
break the publishing - but right now *no* post job runs for these and
that's even worse.

We would need to remove the required-project lines from check and gate
as well but if we do this, they fail completely and thus repos using
this cannot merge anything. Let's do this later once the jobs are
changed to not use tox - see topic:updated-pti.

Change-Id: I5bc1ac2816c1a7bba425d06db9e8bb8bdf025c32

deleted_lines: - publish-openstack-sphinx-docs: required-projects: - openstack/horizon - publish-openstack-sphinx-docs: required-projects: - openstack/neutron

commit_message:
Add OpenShift gates

This commit adds gates that test Kuryr with OpenShift. Complex gates
that test with both OpenShift and CNI daemon enabled are added to
experimental queue only.

Partial-Implements: blueprint enhance-upstream-gates

Change-Id: I4162b31e6af3ca4b527dc5eb17e53be46e013daf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes refs/changes/77/521077/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [ "{{ cloud_engine }}" == "kubernetes" ]; then enable_service kubernetes-api enable_service kubernetes-controller-manager enable_service kubernetes-scheduler # Kubelet enable_service kubelet elif [ "{{ cloud_engine }}" == "openshift" ]; then enable_service openshift_master enable_service openshift_node DOCKER_CGROUP_DRIVER="systemd" fi
deleted_lines: enable_service kubernetes-api enable_service kubernetes-controller-manager enable_service kubernetes-scheduler # Kubelet enable_service kubelet

commit_message:
Integrate OVO in helpers

I0d592bae452876b24c28ca4cc4bf6392b5ab6493 integrated ovo with
neutrons allocation models. OVO can be further integrated in the
helpers file.

This will make the addition of QinQ networks easier because it
refactors the type_vlan code and that logic now uses OVO. Rather
than reverting those changes, consumers of this file should adopt
OVO.

The following projects use helpers.SegmentTypeDriver with a model
that is not an OVO and will be effected by this change:
networking-avaya
networking-bagpipe
networking-h3c

Partial-Bug: #1705719
Change-Id: I4e11cbf22f9fbf0235e68d6eb84ee68a116b0398
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db

deleted_lines: if issubclass(model, base_obj.NeutronDbObject): self.model = model.db_model else: self.model = model self.primary_keys = set(dict(self.model.__table__.columns)) self.primary_keys.remove("allocated") alloc = ( session.query(self.model).filter_by(**raw_segment). first()) if alloc: count = (session.query(self.model). filter_by(allocated=False, **raw_segment). update({"allocated": True})) alloc = self.model(allocated=True, **raw_segment) alloc.save(session) select = (session.query(self.model). filter_by(allocated=False, **filters)) allocs = select.limit(IDPOOL_SELECT_SIZE).all() count = (session.query(self.model). filter_by(allocated=False, **raw_segment). update({"allocated": True}))

commit_message:
Add QinQ model and object

This patch adds the model and object definitions for QinQ
networks.

Partial-Bug: #1705719
Change-Id: Ifd36d9f55ccaabf2925592f343db0fe2b7679fff

You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # """add qinq allocation Revision ID: 4756bcace7bd Revises: c8c222d42aa9 Create Date: 2017-05-03 09:12:33.505419 """ # revision identifiers, used by Alembic. revision = '4756bcace7bd' down_revision = 'c8c222d42aa9' from alembic import op import sqlalchemy as sa def upgrade(): op.create_table('ml2_qinq_allocations', sa.Column('id', sa.Integer(), nullable=False), sa.Column('physical_network', sa.String(length=64), nullable=False), sa.Column('s_tag', sa.Integer(), autoincrement=False, nullable=False), sa.Column('c_tag', sa.Integer(), autoincrement=False, nullable=False), sa.Column('allocated', sa.Boolean(), nullable=False), sa.PrimaryKeyConstraint('id'), sa.UniqueConstraint('physical_network', 's_tag', 'c_tag'), ) op.create_index('ix_ml2_qinq_allocations_physical_network_allocated', 'ml2_qinq_allocations', ['physical_network', 'allocated'], unique=False)

subject: Refactor type_vlan for QinQ compatibility
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-20 14:34:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/12b390923ea693a778ad8e0e18bfd3e39d9bd6fa', 'message': 'Refactor type_vlan for QinQ compatibility

While writing the QinQ driver, the logic for syncing vlan
allocations was somewhat duplicated. This refactors the function
to add conditional cases for it to be compatibile for both drivers.

The QinQ driver adds another layer of keys so instead of set
operations we need to use dictionary operations and also
another layer of nesting is needed for for loops to act on those
values.

Change-Id: Ice309b12ce2693627d8c9d69265fddf195c51161

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/367810/ required me to move the
changes from type_vlan to helpers. However, QinQAllocation does
not have an OVO so I made a class member variable to switch between
the two.. alternatively, and probably better.. I could move the
switching logic into the type_vlan/type_qinq files themselves. This
was just the first thing I thought of.

Related-Bug: #1604222

commit_message:
Refactor type_vlan for QinQ compatibility

While writing the QinQ driver, the logic for syncing vlan
allocations was somewhat duplicated. This commit refactors
it enough so it can be used by both drivers.

The QinQ driver adds another layer of keys so instead of set
operations we need to use dictionary operations and also
another layer of nesting is needed for for loops to act on those
values.

Partial-Bug: #1705719

Change-Id: Ice309b12ce2693627d8c9d69265fddf195c51161
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/31/458531/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.is_vlan = model.__name__ == 'VlanAllocation' def get_allocations_from_db(self, ctx): allocations = {} allocs = ctx.session.query(self.model) for alloc in allocs: if alloc.physical_network not in allocations: if self.is_vlan: allocations[alloc.physical_network] = set() else: allocations[alloc.physical_network] = {} if self.is_vlan: allocations[alloc.physical_network].add(alloc) else: if alloc.s_tag not in allocations[alloc.physical_network]: allocations[alloc.physical_network][alloc.s_tag] = set() allocations[alloc.physical_network][alloc.s_tag].add(alloc) return allocs, allocations def process_network_ranges(self, ctx, allocations, db_allocs, physical_network, ranges): if physical_network in allocations: for alloc in allocations[physical_network]: if self.is_vlan and alloc.vlan_id in ranges: ranges.remove(alloc.vlan_id) elif self.is_vlan and not alloc.allocated: self.remove_unallocatable(ctx, alloc, allocations, db_allocs, physical_network, **{'vlan_id': alloc.vlan_id}) else: for alloc in allocations[physical_network][alloc]: if alloc.s_tag in ranges: del ranges[alloc.s_tag] elif not alloc.allocated: self.remove_unallocatable( ctx, alloc, allocations, db_allocs, physical_network, **{'s_tag': alloc.s_tag}) del allocations[physical_network] def remove_unallocatable(self, ctx, alloc, allocations, db_allocs, physical_network, **filters): if self.is_vlan and not alloc.allocated: self._remove_unallocatable(ctx, alloc, db_allocs, physical_network, **{'vlan_id': alloc.vlan_id}) elif not self.is_vlan and not alloc.allocated: for alloc in allocations[physical_network][alloc.s_tag]: self._remove_unallocatable(ctx, alloc, db_allocs, physical_network, **{'s_tag': alloc.s_tag}) def _remove_unallocatable(self, ctx, alloc, db_allocs, physical_network, **filters): value = None item = None if self.is_vlan: item = 'vlan' value = filters.get('vlan_id') else: item = 's_tag' value = filters.get('s_tag') LOG.debug("Removing %(item)s %(s_tag)s on physical network " "%(physical_network)s from pool", {'item': item, 'value': value, 'physical_network': physical_network}) # This UPDATE WHERE statement blocks anyone # from concurrently changing the allocation # values to True while our transaction is # open so we don't accidentally delete # allocated segments. If someone has # already allocated, count will return 0 so # we don't delete. count = db_allocs.filter_by(allocated=False, physical_network=physical_network, **filters).update({"allocated": False}) if count: ctx.session.delete(alloc)

"}, {'number': 11, 'created': '2017-04-03 21:42:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/22cb1228962833e65ab63257da310342d4eaa05c', 'message': 'WIP: Add QinQ network type driver

This patch aims to add a QinQ network type driver by modifying
the existing segment table and adding an allocation table.

type_qinq.py copies some logic from type_vlan.py and modifies it
to fit the needs of QinQ segments.

A user can confgiure the network with the following format:
    <physical_network>:<s_tag>:<c_tag_min>:<c_tag_max>

If a user specifies the same <physical_network>:<s_tag> pair again,
the c-tags for the matching record will be overwritten.

Related-Bug: #1604222
Change-Id: I46c74dcc0d18d9a6cde930c1f3e2408c0c699557

    Ice309b12ce2693627d8c9d69265fddf195c51161

This patch aims to add a QinQ network type driver by modifying
the existing segment table and adding an allocation table.

type_qinq.py moves some logic from type_vlan.py into helpers.py
and uses/modifies it to fit the needs of QinQ segments.

A user can confgiure the network with the following format:
    <physical_network>:<s_tag>:<c_tag_min>:<c_tag_max>

    Ice309b12ce2693627d8c9d69265fddf195c51161

This patch aims to add a QinQ network type driver by adding an
allocation table for QinQ.

type_qinq.py copied some logic from type_vlan.py so this caused a
refactor into helpers.py type_qinq.py  uses/modifies it to fit the
needs of QinQ segments.

A user can confgiure the network with the following format:
    <physical_network>:<s_tag>:<c_tag_min>:<c_tag_max>

When a user creates a network with the configured s_tag
specified as the provider-segment, it will allocate the
entire c_tag range configured for that s_tag.

Closes-Bug: #1705719
Change-Id: I46c74dcc0d18d9a6cde930c1f3e2408c0c699557

    <physical_network>:<s_tag>:<c_tag_min>:<c_tag_max>

When a user creates a network with the configured s_tag
specified as the provider-segment, it will allocate the
entire c_tag range configured for that s_tag.

Closes-Bug: #1705719

commit_message:
Add QinQ network type driver

NOTE: This patch depends on a refactor so if you can't find
a function definition, check the depends-on link here:
    Ice309b12ce2693627d8c9d69265fddf195c51161

This patch aims to add a QinQ network type driver by adding an
allocation table for QinQ.

type_qinq.py copied some logic from type_vlan.py so this caused a
refactor into helpers.py type_qinq.py  uses/modifies it to fit the
needs of QinQ segments.

A user can confgiure the network with the following format:
    <physical_network>:<s_tag>:<c_tag_min>:<c_tag_max>

When a user creates a network with the configured s_tag
specified as the provider-segment, it will allocate the
entire c_tag range configured for that s_tag.

Closes-Bug: #1705719
Change-Id: I46c74dcc0d18d9a6cde930c1f3e2408c0c699557
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/47/446047/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2014 Thales Services SAS # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import mock from neutron_lib import context from neutron_lib import exceptions as exc from testtools import matchers from neutron.db.models.plugins.ml2 import qinqallocation as qinq_alloc_model from neutron.plugins.common import constants as p_const from neutron.plugins.common import utils as plugin_utils from neutron.plugins.ml2 import config from neutron.plugins.ml2 import driver_api as api from neutron.plugins.ml2.drivers import type_vlan from neutron.tests.unit import testlib_api PROVIDER_NET = 'phys_net1' TENANT_NET = 'phys_net2' VLAN_MIN = 200 VLAN_MAX = 209 QINQ_MIN = 200 QINQ_MAX = 209 NETWORK_VLAN_RANGES = [PROVIDER_NET, "%s:%s:%s" % (TENANT_NET, VLAN_MIN, VLAN_MAX)] UPDATED_VLAN_RANGES = { PROVIDER_NET: [], TENANT_NET: [(VLAN_MIN + 5, VLAN_MAX + 5)], } class QinqTypeTest(testlib_api.SqlTestCase): def setUp(self): super(QinqTypeTest, self).setUp() config.cfg.CONF.set_override('network_vlan_ranges', NETWORK_VLAN_RANGES, group='ml2_type_vlan') self.network_vlan_ranges = plugin_utils.parse_network_vlan_ranges( NETWORK_VLAN_RANGES) self.driver = type_vlan.QinqTypeDriver() self.driver._sync_qinq_allocations() self.context = context.Context() self.driver.physnet_mtus = [] def test_parse_network_exception_handling(self): with mock.patch.object(plugin_utils, 'parse_network_vlan_ranges') as parse_ranges: parse_ranges.side_effect = Exception('any exception') self.assertRaises(SystemExit, self.driver._parse_network_vlan_ranges) def _get_allocation(self, context, segment): return context.session.query( qinq_alloc_model.QinqAllocation).filter_by( physical_network=segment[api.PHYSICAL_NETWORK], qinq_id=segment[api.VLAN_ID], vlan_id=segment[api.SEGMENTATION_ID]).first() def test_partial_segment_is_partial_segment(self): segment = {api.NETWORK_TYPE: p_const.TYPE_VLAN, api.SEGMENTATION_ID: 1} self.assertTrue(self.driver.is_partial_segment(segment)) def test_specific_segment_is_not_partial_segment(self): segment = {api.NETWORK_TYPE: p_const.TYPE_VLAN, api.PHYSICAL_NETWORK: PROVIDER_NET, api.SEGMENTATION_ID: 1, api.VLAN_ID: 200} self.assertFalse(self.driver.is_partial_segment(segment)) def test_validate_provider_segment(self): segment = {api.NETWORK_TYPE: p_const.TYPE_VLAN, api.PHYSICAL_NETWORK: PROVIDER_NET, api.SEGMENTATION_ID: 1, api.VLAN_ID: 200} self.assertIsNone(self.driver.validate_provider_segment(segment)) def test_validate_provider_segment_without_segmentation_id(self): segment = {api.NETWORK_TYPE: p_const.TYPE_VLAN, api.PHYSICAL_NETWORK: TENANT_NET} self.driver.validate_provider_segment(segment) def test_validate_provider_segment_without_physical_network(self): segment = {api.NETWORK_TYPE: p_const.TYPE_VLAN} self.driver.validate_provider_segment(segment) def test_validate_provider_segment_with_missing_physical_network(self): segment = {api.NETWORK_TYPE: p_const.TYPE_VLAN, api.SEGMENTATION_ID: 1} self.assertRaises(exc.InvalidInput, self.driver.validate_provider_segment, segment) def test_validate_provider_segment_with_invalid_physical_network(self): segment = {api.NETWORK_TYPE: p_const.TYPE_VLAN, api.PHYSICAL_NETWORK: 'other_phys_net', api.SEGMENTATION_ID: 1} self.assertRaises(exc.InvalidInput, self.driver.validate_provider_segment, segment) def test_validate_provider_segment_with_invalid_segmentation_id(self): segment = {api.NETWORK_TYPE: p_const.TYPE_VLAN, api.PHYSICAL_NETWORK: PROVIDER_NET, api.SEGMENTATION_ID: 5000} self.assertRaises(exc.InvalidInput, self.driver.validate_provider_segment, segment) def test_validate_provider_segment_with_invalid_input(self): segment = {api.NETWORK_TYPE: p_const.TYPE_VLAN, api.PHYSICAL_NETWORK: PROVIDER_NET, api.SEGMENTATION_ID: 1, 'invalid': 1} self.assertRaises(exc.InvalidInput, self.driver.validate_provider_segment, segment) def test_sync_vlan_allocations(self): def check_in_ranges(network_vlan_ranges): vlan_min, vlan_max = network_vlan_ranges[TENANT_NET][0] segment = {api.NETWORK_TYPE: p_const.TYPE_VLAN, api.PHYSICAL_NETWORK: TENANT_NET} segment[api.SEGMENTATION_ID] = vlan_min - 1 self.assertIsNone( self._get_allocation(self.context, segment)) segment[api.SEGMENTATION_ID] = vlan_max + 1 self.assertIsNone( self._get_allocation(self.context, segment)) segment[api.SEGMENTATION_ID] = vlan_min self.assertFalse( self._get_allocation(self.context, segment).allocated) segment[api.SEGMENTATION_ID] = vlan_max self.assertFalse( self._get_allocation(self.context, segment).allocated) check_in_ranges(self.network_vlan_ranges) self.driver.network_vlan_ranges = UPDATED_VLAN_RANGES self.driver._sync_vlan_allocations() check_in_ranges(UPDATED_VLAN_RANGES) def test_reserve_provider_segment(self): segment = {api.NETWORK_TYPE: p_const.TYPE_VLAN, api.PHYSICAL_NETWORK: PROVIDER_NET, api.SEGMENTATION_ID: 101} alloc = self._get_allocation(self.context, segment) self.assertIsNone(alloc) observed = self.driver.reserve_provider_segment(self.context, segment) alloc = self._get_allocation(self.context, observed) self.assertTrue(alloc.allocated) def test_reserve_provider_segment_already_allocated(self): segment = {api.NETWORK_TYPE: p_const.TYPE_VLAN, api.PHYSICAL_NETWORK: PROVIDER_NET, api.SEGMENTATION_ID: 101} observed = self.driver.reserve_provider_segment(self.context, segment) self.assertRaises(exc.VlanIdInUse, self.driver.reserve_provider_segment, self.context, observed) def test_reserve_provider_segment_in_tenant_pools(self): segment = {api.NETWORK_TYPE: p_const.TYPE_VLAN, api.PHYSICAL_NETWORK: TENANT_NET, api.SEGMENTATION_ID: VLAN_MIN} alloc = self._get_allocation(self.context, segment) self.assertFalse(alloc.allocated) observed = self.driver.reserve_provider_segment(self.context, segment) alloc = self._get_allocation(self.context, observed) self.assertTrue(alloc.allocated) def test_reserve_provider_segment_without_segmentation_id(self): segment = {api.NETWORK_TYPE: p_const.TYPE_VLAN, api.PHYSICAL_NETWORK: TENANT_NET} observed = self.driver.reserve_provider_segment(self.context, segment) alloc = self._get_allocation(self.context, observed) self.assertTrue(alloc.allocated) vlan_id = observed[api.SEGMENTATION_ID] self.assertThat(vlan_id, matchers.GreaterThan(VLAN_MIN - 1)) self.assertThat(vlan_id, matchers.LessThan(VLAN_MAX + 1)) def test_reserve_provider_segment_without_physical_network(self): segment = {api.NETWORK_TYPE: p_const.TYPE_VLAN} observed = self.driver.reserve_provider_segment(self.context, segment) alloc = self._get_allocation(self.context, observed) self.assertTrue(alloc.allocated) vlan_id = observed[api.SEGMENTATION_ID] self.assertThat(vlan_id, matchers.GreaterThan(VLAN_MIN - 1)) self.assertThat(vlan_id, matchers.LessThan(VLAN_MAX + 1)) self.assertEqual(TENANT_NET, observed[api.PHYSICAL_NETWORK]) def test_reserve_provider_segment_all_allocateds(self): for __ in range(VLAN_MIN, VLAN_MAX + 1): self.driver.allocate_tenant_segment(self.context) segment = {api.NETWORK_TYPE: p_const.TYPE_VLAN} self.assertRaises(exc.NoNetworkAvailable, self.driver.reserve_provider_segment, self.context, segment) def test_get_mtu(self): config.cfg.CONF.set_override('global_physnet_mtu', 1475) config.cfg.CONF.set_override('path_mtu', 1400, group='ml2') self.driver.physnet_mtus = {'physnet1': 1450, 'physnet2': 1400} self.assertEqual(1450, self.driver.get_mtu('physnet1')) config.cfg.CONF.set_override('global_physnet_mtu', 1375) config.cfg.CONF.set_override('path_mtu', 1400, group='ml2') self.driver.physnet_mtus = {'physnet1': 1450, 'physnet2': 1400} self.assertEqual(1375, self.driver.get_mtu('physnet1')) config.cfg.CONF.set_override('global_physnet_mtu', 0) config.cfg.CONF.set_override('path_mtu', 1400, group='ml2') self.driver.physnet_mtus = {'physnet1': 1450, 'physnet2': 1400} self.assertEqual(1450, self.driver.get_mtu('physnet1')) config.cfg.CONF.set_override('global_physnet_mtu', 0) config.cfg.CONF.set_override('path_mtu', 0, group='ml2') self.driver.physnet_mtus = {} self.assertEqual(0, self.driver.get_mtu('physnet1')) def test_allocate_tenant_segment(self): for __ in range(VLAN_MIN, VLAN_MAX + 1): segment = self.driver.allocate_tenant_segment(self.context) alloc = self._get_allocation(self.context, segment) self.assertTrue(alloc.allocated) vlan_id = segment[api.SEGMENTATION_ID] self.assertThat(vlan_id, matchers.GreaterThan(VLAN_MIN - 1)) self.assertThat(vlan_id, matchers.LessThan(VLAN_MAX + 1)) self.assertEqual(TENANT_NET, segment[api.PHYSICAL_NETWORK]) def test_allocate_tenant_segment_no_available(self): for __ in range(VLAN_MIN, VLAN_MAX + 1): self.driver.allocate_tenant_segment(self.context) segment = self.driver.allocate_tenant_segment(self.context) self.assertIsNone(segment) def test_release_segment(self): segment = self.driver.allocate_tenant_segment(self.context) self.driver.release_segment(self.context, segment) alloc = self._get_allocation(self.context, segment) self.assertFalse(alloc.allocated) def test_release_segment_unallocated(self): segment = {api.NETWORK_TYPE: p_const.TYPE_VLAN, api.PHYSICAL_NETWORK: PROVIDER_NET, api.SEGMENTATION_ID: 101} with mock.patch.object(type_vlan.LOG, 'warning') as log_warn: self.driver.release_segment(self.context, segment) log_warn.assert_called_once_with( "No vlan_id %(vlan_id)s found on physical network " "%(physical_network)s", {'vlan_id': 101, 'physical_network': PROVIDER_NET})

commit_message:
Add network_map entry to dynamic inventory

This gives a list of all the networks with all the relevant information
about them, which makes it easier to consume via ansible.

One would get the name of the network, the current IP, and the VIP
information for each network (with an empty list if no VIPs exist for
this network).

bp ipsec
Change-Id: I79b40e97095edb3ee165f535ec2e0254cc8baf8e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-validations refs/changes/29/522529/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: vip_map = self.stack_outputs.get('VipMap', {}) # Add variable for getting all the info of a specific # network. ret[name]['vars']['network_map'] = self._get_network_map( role, idx, role_net_ip_map, vip_map) def _get_network_map(self, role, idx, role_net_ip_map, vip_map): def vip_info(name): if vip_map.get(name): return [{ 'name': str(name), 'vip': str(vip_map.get(name)) }] else: return [] def get_vips(net_name): if net_name == 'internal_api': return vip_info(net_name) + vip_info('redis') else: return vip_info(net_name) return [{ 'name': str(net), 'ip': str(role_net_ip_map[role][net][idx]), 'vips': get_vips(net) } for net in role_net_ip_map[role]]

subject: Add a configuration option for the default resource class
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-11-24 16:56:56.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/default-resource-class-e11bacfb01d6841b.yaml', 'ironic/conf/default.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/api/controllers/v1/test_node.py', 'ironic/api/controllers/v1/node.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/265993316b53abac234600b4b516965b82270e16', 'message': "Add a configuration option for the default resource class

If no resource class is provided in a creation request, the value of
the new ``default_resource_class`` configuration option is used.

While this feature is implemented on the API level, it's not a part of
the API contract, so it's not covered by a microversion. It's particularly
important, because it allows this change to apply even to requests
using an old API version, thus making these versions usable after
the mandatory switch to resource classes in nova.

Change-Id: I58232d9c92d6ffca49d334e5fb7078bce19f1cb4
Closes-Bug: #1732190
"}]
commit_message:
Add a configuration option for the default resource class

If no resource class is provided in a creation request, the value of
the new ``default_resource_class`` configuration option is used.

While this feature is implemented on the API level, it's not a part of
the API contract, so it's not covered by a microversion. It's particularly
important, because it allows this change to apply even to requests
using an old API version, thus making these versions usable after
the mandatory switch to resource classes in nova.

Change-Id: I58232d9c92d6ffca49d334e5fb7078bce19f1cb4
Closes-Bug: #1732190

added_lines: from neutron_lib.api.definitions import qos_bw_limit_direction as apidef class Qos_bw_limit_direction(api_extensions.APIExtensionDescriptor): api_definition = apidef
deleted_lines: from neutron_lib.api.definitions import qos as qos_apideffrom neutron_lib import constants as common_constants # The name of the extension. NAME = "Direction for QoS bandwidth limit rule" # The alias of the extension. ALIAS = "qos-bw-limit-direction" # The description of the extension. DESCRIPTION = ("Allow to configure QoS bandwidth limit rule with specific " "direction: ingress or egress") # The list of required extensions. REQUIRED_EXTENSIONS = [qos_apidef.ALIAS] # The list of optional extensions. OPTIONAL_EXTENSIONS = None # The resource attribute map for the extension. SUB_RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTE_MAP = { qos_apidef.BANDWIDTH_LIMIT_RULES: { 'parameters': { 'direction': { 'allow_post': True, 'allow_put': True, 'is_visible': True, 'default': common_constants.EGRESS_DIRECTION, 'validate': { 'type:values': common_constants.VALID_DIRECTIONS}}} } } class Qos_bw_limit_direction(api_extensions.ExtensionDescriptor): @classmethod def get_name(cls): return NAME @classmethod def get_alias(cls): return ALIAS @classmethod def get_description(cls): return DESCRIPTION @classmethod def get_updated(cls): return "2017-04-10T10:00:00-00:00" def get_required_extensions(self): return REQUIRED_EXTENSIONS or [] def get_optional_extensions(self): return OPTIONAL_EXTENSIONS or [] def get_extended_resources(self, version): if version == "2.0": return SUB_RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTE_MAP else: return {}

commit_message:
Add oslo_cache to default_subnet driver

This patch adds oslo_cache to the default subnet driver to
avoid unneed calls to neutron when creating pods (or when
getting subnet information)

Change-Id: I93b6bed424757e4138ba656251ae5da46b857da1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes refs/changes/04/519704/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from kuryr_kubernetes import cache_utilsNETS = None NETS_CACHE_SECONDS = 60 * 5 def _get_cache(): global NETS if NETS is None: NETS = cache_utils.get_client(expiration_time=NETS_CACHE_SECONDS) return NETS cache = _get_cache() network = cache.get(subnet_id) if not network: neutron = clients.get_neutron_client() n_subnet = neutron.show_subnet(subnet_id).get('subnet') network_id = n_subnet['network_id'] n_network = neutron.show_network(network_id).get('network') subnet = os_vif_util.neutron_to_osvif_subnet(n_subnet) network = os_vif_util.neutron_to_osvif_network(n_network) network.subnets.objects.append(subnet) cache.set(subnet_id, network)
deleted_lines: # TODO(ivc): add caching (e.g. oslo.cache with dict backend) neutron = clients.get_neutron_client() n_subnet = neutron.show_subnet(subnet_id).get('subnet') network_id = n_subnet['network_id'] n_network = neutron.show_network(network_id).get('network') subnet = os_vif_util.neutron_to_osvif_subnet(n_subnet) network = os_vif_util.neutron_to_osvif_network(n_network) network.subnets.objects.append(subnet)

commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: If695142020e9d877163f40a10f360b9dce264bb3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cloudkitty refs/changes/72/520872/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Release notes are version independent.version = ''release = ''
deleted_lines: import pbr.version# The version info for the project you're documenting, acts as replacement for # |version| and |release|, also used in various other places throughout the # built documents. # cloudkitty_version = pbr.version.VersionInfo('cloudkitty')version = cloudkitty_version.canonical_version_string()release = cloudkitty_version.version_string_with_vcs()

commit_message:
Fix typo in ganesha VIP order constraint

'ganesha' was spelled 'gansha'.  There was no functional bug
since the typo was consistent between definition and use but
fix it so the codebase is easier to search.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Ia89f336b186fb15acea2c37410c576d6b5fd8153

commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: Iaa148b46f1495f07214723265e67a1e65be978be

commit_message:
Fix applying pci whitelist in nova compute

This commit Iccf86f42448d2e7e682728cb82808f91b6d8124e
remove the nova::compute::pci_passthrough which is
deprecate. Therefore we need to update the nova-compute.yaml
according to this change.

Change-Id: I015936b199e0a7b3c0bf5b7b091c50730140b916

commit_message:
Fix lint test failures

With the merge of https://review.openstack.org/520177 in the
tests repo some ansible-lint failures which previously were
not being picked up are now detected.

Some docs config changes were also missed in the zuul job
setup, so they're also fixed.

Change-Id: I8b72bf83996451166fca5b20990c549fc0129306

commit_message:
translations: Use installed os-testr

We do not need to install os-testr for each run, it's already installed
on the nodepool images we use. Thus change the script to use the
installed environment.

Change-Id: Ifa98cb4e7d35c2b45996a7f4fce9eba953f20c99
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/28/522928/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Our images have os-test installed in the following location TESTR_VENV=/usr/os-testr-env if [[ "$ERROR_ABORT" -eq 1 ]] ; then $TESTR_VENV/bin/generate-subunit $TRANS_START_TIME $SECONDS \ 'fail' $JOBNAME >> $SUBUNIT_OUTPUT else $TESTR_VENV/bin/generate-subunit $TRANS_START_TIME $SECONDS \ 'success' $JOBNAME >> $SUBUNIT_OUTPUT fi gzip -9 $SUBUNIT_OUTPUT
deleted_lines: if [[ "$ERROR_ABORT" -eq 1 ]] ; then $VENV/bin/generate-subunit $TRANS_START_TIME $SECONDS \ 'fail' $JOBNAME >> $SUBUNIT_OUTPUT else $VENV/bin/generate-subunit $TRANS_START_TIME $SECONDS \ 'success' $JOBNAME >> $SUBUNIT_OUTPUT fi gzip -9 $SUBUNIT_OUTPUT # Install subunit for the subunit output stream for # healthcheck.openstack.org. $VENV/bin/pip install -U os-testr

commit_message:
Don't use oslo context get_logging_values

get_logging_values has been changed recently to not pass the token
anymore, call to_dict as expected.

Change-Id: I3a7f1293a4d0082274af270f86b5c732d898f8bc
Closes-Bug: #1733345

commit_message:
Parse pcs auth output with all pcs versions

Newer pcs versions don't print "Debug Output" messages anymore
but use "Debug Stdout". Since the pcs cluster auth functions
parse that output, let's make sure we match both strings.

Change-Id: I32a7a9fa4b896871929fcae847bba3481df5b517
Closes-Bug: #1718186
Partial-Bug: #1733372
(cherry picked from commit a2e9675cda2e9152569ce4ab0f69484c03fc7c93)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-pacemaker refs/changes/31/521631/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: inside_debug_block = false if line =~ /--Debug (Output|Stdout) End--/ inside_debug_block = true if line =~ /--Debug (Output|Stdout) Start--/
deleted_lines: inside_debug_block = false if line == '--Debug Output End--' inside_debug_block = true if line == '--Debug Output Start--'

commit_message:
Allow the haproxy configuration to run with limited groups

The haproxy config we have makes a couple assumptions about groups being
present. this change simply improves our existing config so that it
works should a deployer omit common groups within a deployment.

Change-Id: Iae3798c98c250e959f660603263405aa88a4e1a1
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Collect OVS databases in tempest logs

When tempest jobs run, we're not collecting openvswitch databases
and sometimes they're useful for debugging purposes since they
contain all the transactions that have happened during the run.

Co-Authored-By: Miguel Angel Ajo <majopela@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ie06d1a20cb0bb25fa1e0cd4352cf27c1dcf3d01c
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix the host_get_all_by_queries() method

Current logic misjudges that a ComputeHost object does not have an
attribute which is specified in a query if the value of the attribute
is 0 or False. This patch fixes the logic.

Change-Id: I9143f11dd022fe3f683c0f3a2a87c3f5562461d8

commit_message:
Use addClassResourceCleanup to cleanup floatingips

This is to use addClassResourceCleanup for the cleanup of floatingips,
so the cleanup in resource_cleanup can be removed.

Change-Id: If8fdf2278b1b70f94816c4fe1a78566c8ac999a5

commit_message:
Collect logs to a subfolder

The logs and ara report generated by zuul are
overwriting some of our log content, so this
patch puts our logs into a subfolder instead.

Change-Id: I28712418fb6db4857dc9f74b2ee8b2fbeb651853
(cherry picked from commit 5868c615a45d95699a2da707d1832dc37c120044)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-tests refs/changes/79/522879/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: dest: "{{ zuul.executor.log_root }}/"

Change-Id: I21ca95a9f2e410a52a7b64c99fad85749d52473a

commit_message:
Install python-apt before hooks run

Previously this charm had relied on python-apt being installed by
the principle. As charms migrate to py3 this is no longer a safe
assumption and actually never was. This change ensures that
python-apt is installed before immediatly. This follows the same
pattern

Change-Id: I21ca95a9f2e410a52a7b64c99fad85749d52473a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-nova-lxd refs/changes/62/523062/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Change PermitRootLogin to allow alternate options
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-11-06 15:07:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ansible-hardening/commit/a5ff58476f6dc4fbbd8fb1910c361eca78069703', 'message': "Change PermitRootLogin to be a string

PermitRootLogin can be 'yes', 'no' or 'without-password' this patch
changes the security_sshd_permit_root_login option to allow this to
be a string rather than a boolean value.

Previously, we could only set this value to 'no'.

Change-Id: I5ee5ff6abc4578d17d4b23d8a2fa1648508ceeed
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-11-06 18:09:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ansible-hardening/commit/bbb0932e0548ddccef481164364dc8019c4b378e', 'message': 'Change PermitRootLogin to allow alternate options

PermitRootLogin can be 'yes', 'no', 'without-password',
'prohibit-password' or 'forced-commands-only'.
This patch changes the functionality to ensure that
security_sshd_permit_root_login is one of the above settings - if so, it
will use that value.

Due to the way Ansible handles "no" and "yes", we have to check if the
value is "False" (string equivalent for boolean no), and if so output
"no", otherwise output the string (which would be one of the above
options).

Previously, we could only set this value to 'no'.

Change-Id: I5ee5ff6abc4578d17d4b23d8a2fa1648508ceeed
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2017-11-06 18:56:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ansible-hardening/commit/89e3c1d105dd946bdba0fd7c36710c94d2412ba8', 'message': 'Change PermitRootLogin to allow alternate options

security_sshd_permit_root_login is one of the above settings - if so, it
will use that value.

Due to the way Ansible handles "no" and "yes", we have to check if the
value is "False" (string equivalent for boolean no), and if so output
"no", otherwise output the string (which would be one of the above
options).

Previously, we could only set this value to 'no'.

Change-Id: I5ee5ff6abc4578d17d4b23d8a2fa1648508ceeed
'}]
commit_message:
Change PermitRootLogin to allow alternate options

PermitRootLogin can be 'yes', 'no', 'without-password',
'prohibit-password' or 'forced-commands-only'.
This patch changes the functionality to ensure that
security_sshd_permit_root_login is one of the above settings - if so, it
will use that value.

Due to the way Ansible handles "no" and "yes", we have to check if the
value is "False" (string equivalent for boolean no), and if so output
"no", otherwise output the string (which would be one of the above
options).

Previously, we could only set this value to 'no'.

Change-Id: I5ee5ff6abc4578d17d4b23d8a2fa1648508ceeed

commit_message:
Update upgrade documentation with the Ceph related steps

Adds in the upgrade guide the notes and additional steps necessary
to migrate the Ceph cluster to containers.

Change-Id: I923e8aa34d542e6f503baf1d776a5c3fdd8a2fda
Closes-Bug: #1716497
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-docs refs/changes/35/511635/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Ceph clusters deployed with Ocata via puppet-ceph will be migrated to ceph-ansible and use containers during the Ocata do Pike upgrade. If the Overcloud has been deployed with Ceph, then add the ceph-ansible.yaml environment file to the upgrade command:: openstack overcloud deploy --templates \ -e <full environment> \ -e /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates/environments/docker.yaml \ -e /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates/environments/ceph-ansible/ceph-ansible.yaml \ -e /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates/environments/major-upgrade-composable-steps-docker.yaml \ -e overcloud-repos.yaml Any customization for the Ceph deployment previously passed as hieradata via *ExtraConfig must be removed or the deployment will stop, including the list of devices to be used as OSDs, previously set via ``ceph::profile::params::osds``. It is possible to use instead the ``CephAnsibleExtraConfig`` or ``CephAnsibleDisksConfig`` parameters to pass arbitrary variables to ceph-ansible, like ``devices`` and ``dedicated_devices`` which are the variables it uses to configure the list of OSD devices. See the `ceph-ansible scenarios`_ or the :doc:`TripleO Ceph config guide <../advanced_deployment/ceph_config>` The other parameters (for example ``CinderRbdPoolName``, ``CephClientUserName``, ...) will behave as they used to with puppet-ceph with the only exception of ``CephPools``. This can be used to create additional pools in the Ceph cluster but the two tools expect the list to be in a different format. Specifically while puppet-ceph expected it in this format:: { "mypool": { "size": 1, "pg_num": 32, "pgp_num": 32 } } with ceph-ansible that would become:: [{"name": "mypool", "pg_num": 32, "rule_name": ""}] .. note::
deleted_lines: It is not yet possible to migrate an existing puppet-ceph deployment to a ceph-ansible deployment. Only new deployments are currently possible with ceph-ansible.

commit_message:
Use 'find' to replace the list method when search volume.

Fix error when "zun run --mount=<volume-name>" that could
not find the volume.

Closes-bug: #1733288

Change-Id: I48133eed64223d2edb6f5cd64c5b255d12b16490
Signed-off-by: Kevin Zhao <kevin.zhao@arm.com>

added_lines: if self.context.is_admin: volumes = self.cinder.volumes.list( search_opts={'name': volume, 'all_tenants': 1}) else: volumes = self.cinder.volumes.list( search_opts={'name': volume})

subject: Initialize ovn_client properly when mech_driver object is reused
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-11-20 19:03:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn/commit/a939853fdb8ae178304a6f2f485c458ad9ceaa5b', 'message': 'Initialize ovn_client properly when mech_driver object is reused

Functional tests currently reuse the mech_driver object and
TestOVNFunctionalBase class calls post_fork_initialize() method.
This forces the IDL connections to be renewed but old ovn_client
object still holds the references to the old connections which
produces NotConnectedError exceptions in ovsdbapp.

This patch fixes it by resetting the ovn_client instance in the
mechanism driver in the post_fork_initialize() method.

Closes-Bug: #1733399

commit_message:
Initialize ovn_client properly when mech_driver object is reused

Functional tests currently reuse the mech_driver object and
TestOVNFunctionalBase class calls post_fork_initialize() method.
This forces the IDL connections to be renewed but old ovn_client
object still holds the references to the old connections which
produces NotConnectedError exceptions in ovsdbapp.

This patch fixes it by resetting the ovn_client instance in the
mechanism driver in the post_fork_initialize() method.

Closes-Bug: #1733399

Change-Id: I85fc8c54c0bda4bdfc76f9f74ec40260d998b756
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/35/521635/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self._ovn_client_inst = None # Now IDL connections can be safely used. self._post_fork_event.set()

commit_message:
Resolve ansible-lint test failures

With the merge of https://review.openstack.org/520177 in the
tests repo some ansible-lint failures which previously were
not being picked up are now detected.

This adds the appropriate skip tags to the tasks so that they
are not evaluated by ansible-lint.

commit_message:
libvirt check: use unqualified hostname

Nova will always use an unqualified host name for an instance's
compute node. If monasca-agent is configured to use a compute
node's fully qualified host name for metrics and that gets used for
looking up the instances running on that node, Nova will return
zero results. This commit fixes this problem by always reducing
the the host name to its first component.

Change-Id: Ie29cb2dc305c8b2d4c551d1512e0e755f9e38cb6
Story: 2001251
Task: 5781
(cherry picked from commit 48729136a7a01b07624b702f0b59af3c69e3fcca)

commit_message:
Update bindep.txt for doc builds

https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html#documentation
specifies that doc dependencies need the doc tag in bindep, use it.

Leave test environment in for transition period until we use the new
scripts.

Change-Id: I4a46d77036e6bbfd45b576ce8e0528d5660f188d

commit_message:
Don't change directory while running init-runonce

Currently init-runonce script changes directory to the
script's base directory (/usr/...) before doing anything else.
This unnecessarily _forces_ a non-root user to use sudo for
running this script thereby raising privileges for code which
doesn't want it. Also downloading temporary stuff in places like
/usr... seems not a good choice.

Hence deleting the said code part and letting the deployer work
comfortably from any directory.

Made documentation changes accordingly.

Change-Id: Ib3c7ed97aa5f53c115b6337aaf572b5fdc7a71f3
Closes-Bug: #1732963

commit_message:
Add DeployIdentifier to Nova discover hosts container

Resolves an issue during scale out where the Nova init
container that runs discover hosts wasn't executing on a Heat
stack update if the container name and configs all stayed the same.

Change-Id: Ie2ecd3dbddb1cf3ee5bba6f7b33e11bc9b6b8b4e
Closes-bug: 1733966
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/97/522397/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: DeployIdentifier: default: '' type: string description: > Setting this to a unique value will re-run any deployment tasks which perform configuration on a Heat stack-update. environment: # NOTE: this should force this container to re-run on each # update (scale-out, etc.) - list_join: - '' - - 'TRIPLEO_DEPLOY_IDENTIFIER=' - {get_param: DeployIdentifier}

commit_message:
Remove SSLMiddleware

We deprecate SSLMiddleware in 6.0.0, and announce to remove it at
8.0.0. Now will be a good time to remove it out.

Change-Id: Iaf9be21ffcec9018ad91a5122ed7f2477a7e4a52

commit_message:
Do not force using the remote "origin" when testing upgrades

Zuul checkout of origin/stable/pike doesn't work, and needs
only stable/pike instead [1].

[1]: http://logs.openstack.org/periodic/git.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/master/openstack-ansible-upgrade-ceph-ubuntu-xenial/f835b74/job-output.txt.gz#_2017-11-24_06_08_06_547867

Change-Id: Ib2bee665e164f02817487c311e125329d54c43d8

commit_message:
Add missing volume RBAC test

Add missing RBAC test for 'show_group_type'
API [0] which enforces "group:access_group_type_specs"
according to policy in code docs [1].
[0]https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/block-storage/v3/#show-group-type-details
[1]https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/76231f3ad2828fe7bb60ecd9686db807622bbb7a/cinder/policies/group_types.py#L53

Change-Id: I71c81d0798082c03408d75deb021e7fcf077b938

commit_message:
Add connection row to ovn db

Add connection row to ovn db and change the inactivity_probe
from 5s to 60s.

Depends-on: I85fc8c54c0bda4bdfc76f9f74ec40260d998b756
Change-Id: I330588d477a321c51c50a036703ee338dc1933a6

added_lines: ovn-nbctl --db=unix:/usr/local/var/run/openvswitch/ovnnb_db.sock set-connection ptcp:6641:0.0.0.0 -- set connection . inactivity_probe=60 ovn-sbctl --db=unix:/usr/local/var/run/openvswitch/ovnsb_db.sock set-connection ptcp:6642:0.0.0.0 -- set connection . inactivity_probe=60

subject: Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-11-17 09:07:03.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/source/conf.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/automaton/commit/c9550dc65acbf1fcf02a30b733ba68db29a4ce03', 'message': "Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: Idc3bf6f4d620e1b7b10600dc28d46dd2e7d0d9e8
"}]
commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at

commit_message:
Use the proper link name for the newton dlrn variable

The previous fix used the wrong "current-tripleo" link name. However for
newton we still use the legacy "current-passed-ci" link on the DLRN
server.

Also fix "passed-ci" to "current-passed-ci" in the list of known dlrn
hashes.

Change-Id: I70afa68fbc1d941b128fadcc1d25b4d3e4a88d8b
Closes-Bug: #1733598

commit_message:
Remove use_neutron from sahara config

Nova network has been fully removed from the OpenStack codebase.
As such, all instances of switches on use_neutron should be removed,
as the functionality will never be meaningful.

Change-Id: I6af9af897b5a4416082307e01dca951c9b7026ad
Depends-On: Ib9d87dd339d637b69fb27315d92228cbc523c8eb

commit_message:
Configure glance ceph during upgrade and genconfig

Previously the glance ceph backend was only being configured during
the deploy and reconfigure commands. This change ensures that it is
configured during the upgrade and genconfig commands as well.

Some of the related host/group selection logic has been cleaned up,
as it was a little tautolgous.

Change-Id: Ibfc2bfaaf2e24fb3a0697925e7723794046787fa
Closes-Bug: #1728060

commit_message:
Temporary work around a docker issue

Docker daemon responses 500 if calling exec_resize on an non-existing
exec instance. This patch work around the issue until it is fixed
in Docker side.

See: https://github.com/moby/moby/issues/35561

Change-Id: I1372d22eaae0b1fa42b91873f9b749a275478b71
Related-Bug: #1732498
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zun refs/changes/46/521946/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from zun.common.i18n import _ def exec_resize(self, exec_id, height=None, width=None): # NOTE(hongbin): This is a temporary work-around for a docker issue # See: https://github.com/moby/moby/issues/35561 try: super(DockerHTTPClient, self).exec_resize( exec_id, height=height, width=width) except errors.APIError as e: if "process not found for container" in str(e): raise exception.Invalid(_( "no such exec instance: %s") % str(e)) raise

commit_message:
Disable glance file backend with external Ceph

When using external Ceph cluster, glance_api container is only running
on one controller instead of running on all of them.

But when an external Ceph cluster is used, enable_ceph is false so
glance_backend_file is true

Using "not glance_backend_ceph | bool" instead of "not enable_ceph |
bool" should be enough.

Change-Id: I191e5ea7a0d51b0e19ed58a819c3ade5070f623d
Closes-Bug: #1722905

commit_message:
Remove deprecated version dependencies in quickstart

Mitaka and newton are deprecated and no longer maintained
by OpenStack comunity.

Users can check specific documentation for old releases.

Change-Id: I43fd1d40bc2f094fee4c1547879f798a92593df4

commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html

Change-Id: I58b359848331f9d6621f6ce3f67665b14610027a

commit_message:
Generate stestr.conf

When run functional tests, a warning was raised:

UserWarning: No .stestr.conf file found in the CWD. Please create one
to to replace the .testr.conf. [1]

This patch creates a .stestr.conf file but keep .testr.conf. Will
remove it & its usage when testrepository is completely replaced by
stestr. OpenStack has a long-term plan for this [2].

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/67/521567/1/check/openstack-tox-py35/77ed34b/job-output.txt.gz#_2017-11-20_16_11_00_990062
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/491075/

Change-Id: I1a8fb9de958ba8f876097b30530b6f55e59350fc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/16/521916/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add scenario test of lease expiration

The reserved host for blazar users are released when the lease expires,
and host aggregate that created for Blazar is deleted.
Check the instance created during the expiration has been removed
by release of host.

Change-Id: Ied3c766a1d7d839eb4301b494e4b35c75151f242

commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: Ic580bc42c7f2334a09666daf9bcb0fee9a517b97
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/watcher-dashboard refs/changes/48/520748/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add a validation to create lease API

The create lease API doesn't check request body has required parameters
or not. If a request doesn't have required parameters, the API returns
500 Internal Server.

This patch adds a validation method to check whether a request body has
required parameters, start_time, end_time and lease name.

Change-Id: Ibde14d3821b858db962228bf90294efb821cc462
Closes-Bug: #1710809

Make the name of CPUInfo type more friendly

Since code is 'json.loads(value)', it's more firendly
to tell users the expected format should be JSON string

commit_message:
Cleanup nova cell configuration before config it

Some old configuration(such as, LOG_COLOR config) will remain
if we don't cleanup.

So, we should cleanup the configuration before we config it.

Change-Id: I7aff609dadf3acba13a36894614b35005f51280d

commit_message:
Align tox_install.sh with other projects

The tox_install.sh here behaves a bit differently than the others, which
is causing some problems when trying to rework some of the shared gate jobs.

Align it to the form used in other repos.

Change-Id: I3d2b391fba9be6290eb245924014134fbdde717a

added_lines: sudo cat /etc/apt/sources.list.available.d/ubuntu-cloud-archive-pike.list | sudo tee -a /etc/kolla/sources.list if [[ "${BUILD_IMAGE}" == "False" ]]; then return sudo docker run -d -p 4000:5000 --restart=always -v /opt/kolla_registry/:/var/lib/registry --name registry registry:2 pushd "${KOLLA_SRC_DIR}" sudo tox -e "build-${BASE_DISTRO}-${INSTALL_TYPE}" popd
deleted_lines: # Get base distro and install type from workspace. The full path looks like # /home/jenkins/workspace/gate-kolla-ansible-dsvm-deploy-centos-source-centos-7-nv # NOTE(Jeffrey4l): use different a docker namespace name in case it pull image from hub.docker.io when deplying sudo cat /etc/apt/sources.list.available.d/ubuntu-cloud-archive.list | sudo tee -a /etc/kolla/sources.list sudo docker run -d -p 4000:5000 --restart=always -v /opt/kolla_registry/:/var/lib/registry --name registry registry:2 # NOTE(Jeffrey4l): Zuul adds all changes depend on to ZUUL_CHANGES # variable. if find "openstack/kolla:" string, it means this patch depends # on one of Kolla patch. Then build image by using Kolla's code. # Otherwise, pull images from tarballs.openstack.org site. # NOTE(inc0): Publisher variable is set when Kolla runs publisher jobs. # When that happens we don't build images, we download them from temp location. if echo "$ZUUL_CHANGES" | grep -i "openstack/kolla:" && ! [[ $PUBLISHER ]]; then pushd "${GIT_PROJECT_DIR}/kolla" sudo tox -e "build-${BASE_DISTRO}-${INSTALL_TYPE}" popd else BRANCH=$(echo "$ZUUL_BRANCH" | cut -d/ -f2) filename=${BASE_DISTRO}-${INSTALL_TYPE}-registry-${BRANCH}.tar.gz wget -q -c -O "/tmp/$filename" \ "${NODEPOOL_TARBALLS_MIRROR}/kolla/images/${TMP_REGISTRY}${filename}" sudo tar xzf "/tmp/$filename" -C /opt/kolla_registry

commit_message:
Handle shared network senario

Create a network that shared by all tenants. Create container from shared
network in different tenants. The container will fail with docker internal
error.

Reproduce
=========
$ source /opt/stack/devstack/openrc admin admin
$ openstack network create --share test
$ openstack subnet create --subnet-range 10.2.0.0/24 --network test testsubnet
$ zun run --net network=test nginx
$ source /opt/stack/devstack/openrc demo demo
$ zun run --net network=test nginx
$ zun show cdfa61e6-3764-4f47-ac11-8ea54a4394e6
...
| status | Error
| status_reason | Docker internal error: 500 Server Error: Internal Server
Error ("IpamDriver.RequestPool: Another pool with same cidr exist. ipam and
network options not used to pass pool name").

This bug needs to the depends-on patch in kuryr-libnetwork.

Depends-On: I7a0907a6af91b27c4dcc2b543346814182e94ddb
Change-Id: I9e84acc294ac891f3d4e65866dd2cf415309ed01
Closes-Bug: #1727910

commit_message:
Fix the format mess

File name and path should be marked[1]. Otherwise it may cause some
format issue as this bug attachment shows.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/doc-contrib-guide/rst-conv/inline-markups.html#file-name-and-path

Change-Id: I1647f1904970f746de0dd55108c161ce30639b22
Closes-Bug: #1733835

Support function update command

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-qinlingclient refs/changes/91/522991/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _get_package_file(package_path=None, file_path=None): if package_path: if not zipfile.is_zipfile(package_path): raise exceptions.QinlingClientException( 'Package %s is not a valid ZIP file.' % package_path ) return package_path if file_path: if not os.path.isfile(file_path): raise exceptions.QinlingClientException( 'File %s not exist.' % file_path ) base_name, extention = os.path.splitext(file_path) base_name = os.path.basename(base_name) zip_file = os.path.join( tempfile.gettempdir(), '%s.zip' % base_name ) zf = zipfile.ZipFile(zip_file, mode='w') try: # Use default compression mode, may change in future. zf.write( file_path, '%s%s' % (base_name, extention), compress_type=zipfile.ZIP_STORED ) finally: zf.close() return zip_file zip_file = _get_package_file(parsed_args.package, parsed_args.file) help="Function entry in the format of <module_name>.<method_name>" ) package_group = parser.add_argument_group('package_group') swift_group = parser.add_argument_group('swift_group') group = package_group.add_mutually_exclusive_group() group.add_argument( "--file", metavar="CODE_FILE_PATH", help="Code file path." ) group.add_argument( "--package", metavar="CODE_PACKAGE_PATH", help="Code package zip file path." ) swift_group.add_argument( "--container", help="Container name in Swift.", ) swift_group.add_argument( "--object", help="Object name in Swift.", code = None package = None zip_file = None if parsed_args.file or parsed_args.package: code = {'source': 'package'} zip_file = _get_package_file(parsed_args.package, parsed_args.file) elif parsed_args.container or parsed_args.object: code = { 'source': 'swift', 'swift': { 'container': parsed_args.container, 'object': parsed_args.object } } if zip_file: with open(zip_file, 'rb') as package: func = client.functions.update( parsed_args.id, code=code, package=package, name=parsed_args.name, description=parsed_args.description, entry=parsed_args.entry, ) else: func = client.functions.update( parsed_args.id, code=code, name=parsed_args.name, description=parsed_args.description, entry=parsed_args.entry, )
deleted_lines: zip_file = None if parsed_args.file: if not os.path.isfile(parsed_args.file): raise exceptions.QinlingClientException( 'File %s not exist.' % parsed_args.file ) base_name, extention = os.path.splitext(parsed_args.file) base_name = os.path.basename(base_name) zip_file = os.path.join( tempfile.gettempdir(), '%s.zip' % base_name ) zf = zipfile.ZipFile(zip_file, mode='w') try: # Use default compression mode, may change in future. zf.write( parsed_args.file, '%s%s' % (base_name, extention), compress_type=zipfile.ZIP_STORED ) finally: zf.close() if parsed_args.package: if not zipfile.is_zipfile(parsed_args.package): raise exceptions.QinlingClientException( 'Package %s is not a valid ZIP file.' % parsed_args.package ) zip_file = parsed_args.package help="Function entry, in the format of <module_name>.<method_name>" func = client.functions.update( parsed_args.id, name=parsed_args.name, description=parsed_args.description, entry=parsed_args.entry, )

commit_message:
Allow custom FQDNs for over/under-clouds endpoints

Allow to customize t-h-t 'Cloud*' params for overcloud and undercloud.

Move defaults to the common role, and make undercloud names to follow the
overcloud names by default, yet allowing to diverge. F.e. RDOcloud uses an
'rdocloud' domain, therefore some DNS things might be failing
with the 'localdomain' hardcoded values.

Change the subdomains placement order from 'overcloud.storage.localdomain' to
'storage.overcloud.localdomain'. That allows to consistently propagate changes
to the overcloud/undercloud endpoints' names based on a single change provided
for undercloud_domain or overcloud_domain, e.g:
 - storage.overcloud.localdomain
 - storage.undercloud.customdomain

Split common defaults' roles vars into generic and networking related.

Depends-on: Iad63142b241f9f7f0bbef68473f18b69f36daf76

Related-bug: #1698349
Closes-bug: #1733873

Change-Id: Ie83f5668ab3947396ac14e4375d2a50c3aed0657
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras refs/changes/66/522266/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: See also domain names related variables in the extras-common role defaults.
deleted_lines: * `overcloud_cloud_name`: Sets the FQDN for the overcloud's public VIP. * `overcloud_cloud_name_internal`: Sets the FQDN for the overcloud's VIP for the internal network. * `overcloud_cloud_name_storage`: Sets the FQDN for the overcloud's VIP for the storage network. * `overcloud_cloud_name_storage_management`: Sets the FQDN for the overcloud's VIP for the storage management network. * `overcloud_cloud_name_ctlplane`: Sets the FQDN for the overcloud's VIP for the ctlplane network. * `overcloud_cloud_domain`: Sets the domain for the nodes' internal hostnames.

commit_message:
Remove glusterfs-native job from check queue

In the manila community meeting it was resolved [1]
to remove unmaintained drivers from the check queue
to avoid waste of infrastructure resources and to
remove "red noise" from the gerrit review pages.

Do so for the glusterfs-native driver.  Leave the
job defined as it is run in the experimental queue
and in devstack-glusterfs-plugin.

[1[ http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-meeting-alt/%23openstack-meeting-alt.2017-11-02.log.html#t2017-11-02T15:26:17

Change-Id: I87f15ee7f73a8b4a16ae0549d0f2fae4b4c23ec2

commit_message:
Add __all__ to __init__ for service clients

Make it easier to consume the service clients by defining
__alll__ in the __init__ of v1 v2 and admin service clients.

Change-Id: I65f5aaa59124c3564911004fd8c7532247ea114c
